Ей в работе помогает муж. Она уже более 4 года продвигает свой бизнес. Ширингул покупает скота, откармливает несколько месяцев, потом продает их на скотном рынке. Сейчас она хочет купить скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и не потерять источник дохода. Доход от животноводства обеспечить ее семью. По этой причине Ширингул обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Shiringul. She is 34 years old. She is a resident of the Pyandj region. Shiringul is married and the mother of four children. Her children are studying in secondary school. Her husband rears animals. Shiringul farms. She looks after the children, runs the household, and simultaneously rears livestock. Shiringul manages to find time to do everything. Her husband helps her in her work. She has been running her business for over four years already. Shiringul buys livestock, feeds them up for a few months, then sells them at the livestock market. Now she wants to buy some livestock in order to develop further and not lose a source of income. The income from rearing animals provides for her family. For this reason Shiringul has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Life in the Philippines is a big challenge especially in raising a family. Evelyn and her husband put their best effort to provide for their children and give them an education as it is their path for better opportunities in life.  

Evelyn and her husband derive income from their junk shop. They engage in the buying and selling of recyclable materials. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines. While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials such as metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories.

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase old newspapers, galvanized iron, plastic, paper, and metal products to sell. Operating a junk shop is literally a dirty business but she values it for it their main source of income to provide for her family and send her children to school. Evelyn's precious dream is to send her children to college to prepare them for a better future. 

Every week Evelyn meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 54 years old, married and has two children.

Rowena is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married woman with children. She is a business woman owning a retail shop.

However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital. In a bid to increase on her working capital and expand her business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy stock ie cartons of salt, cooking oil, baking flour, corn flour,rice, soap, sugar among other demanded items for sell. She is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost business by buying retail stock for resale

loans.name: Griselda Esmeralda

texts.es: A sus 27 años de edad Griselda cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos básicos, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz ya que puede estar pendiente de su hija también. Griselda vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 4 años, junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad. Griselda desea invertir en su tienda, ya que cada día son más las personas que se acercan a solicitar de sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en: golosinas, leche, cereales, lácteos, granos básicos, bebidas, pan entre otros para surtir más su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
At 27 years old, Griselda has a small store with basic products. This lets her support her family and makes her happy since she can take care of her daughter as well. Griselda has lived in her own house for 4 years now with her husband and small 2 year old daughter.

Griselda wants to invest in her store since every day more people come to ask for her products, which is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that she will invest in: candy, milk, cereals, dairy products, sodas, and bread amongst others so she can better stock her store and increase her profits.

loans.use: to invest in: candy, milk, cereals, dairy products, sodas, and bread amongst others so she can better stock her store and increase her profits.

loans.name: Nidia Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia Nidia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de colonias entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "PADRE URRACA". Nidia continues with her business selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes and others. She expresses her thanks on this profile and likewise promises to comply with her payment in the stipulated installments.

She is a responsible and hard-working person, and in this way she helps her family get ahead. She is asking for this loan so she can buy colognes and other products.

loans.use: to buy colognes and other products.

loans.name: Jose Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, de 76 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene una hija que ya está casada. 

Mauro, inicio a trabajar junto a su padre como jornalero en las fincas de café desde la edad de 10 años, de esa forma aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura y actualmente tiene 20 años de trabajar en la albañilería, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a uno de sus amigos; pero además tiene más de un año de tener una pequeña tienda, la cual atiende con ayuda de su esposa, de esta forma obtienen ingresos para cubrir con sus gastos.

El crédito que está solicitando es para surtir más la tienda con productos de primera necesidad.

Mauro, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y tener mayores comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mauro is 76 years old and studied up to Grade 6. He is married, his wife is a housewife. He has a daughter who is already married.

Mauro started to work as day labor on coffee plantations alongside his father at the age of 10. In this way he learned to do agricultural work and he now has 20 years experience working in bricklaying. He learned this trade thanks to one of his friends. He also has had a small store for more than one year which he takes care of with the help of his wife. In this way they get income to cover their expenses.

The loan that he is requesting is to stock his store with more basic food products.

Mauro dreams of improving his house and having more comfort in his home

loans.use: to stock more basic food products in his store.

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia, de 30 años de edad, solo estudio educación media, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposo para realizar sus actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a la escuela. 

Lucia, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio se lo ha enseñado su pareja; durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas que alquilan y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender leche.
 

Lucia, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas, que le ayudaran a  producir más leche para poder elaborar lácteos y ofrecerlos en los alrededores.

Lucia, sueña con comprar un vehículo para ofrecer sus productos en otros lugares fuera de su localidad.
texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old. She only studied until middle school. She is in a common law marriage. Her husband works in agriculture. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. with her husband to take care of the daily tasks while her children are in school. Lucia works in agriculture. She learned this work from her husband. During the morning they work on land they rent, and they spend the afternoon milking cows in order to sell milk.

Lucia needs a loan to buy two cows, which will help her produce more milk to be able to make milk products and offer them in the surrounding areas. Lucia dreams of buying a vehicle to offer her products in other areas outside her community.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras 3 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo en equipo. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por salir adelante.
La Sra. Carmen, una de las integrantes, solicita este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que por medio de la venta de los mismos tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante y ayuda así a su familia.
Carmen esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar por medio de las capacitaciones que ofrece la fundación paraguaya a través de sus programas.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres Luchadoras 3 [Women Fighters 3], is in it's first loan cycle. It is a new group which hopes to help the group's families through their teamwork. They are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to get ahead. 

Carmen, one of the members, is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to sell, since through selling these she has the means to help her family. She is a very hardworking person, who with sacrifice is getting ahead and helps her family. 

Carmen is thankful for the opportunity she is given to be able to progress through the training which the Fundación Paraguaya offers through its programs.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 22 years old. He is single, and his business is motorcycle taxi transport. 

He has been in this business for one year. He earns a monthly income of twelve thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle. 

He will use the profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his brother. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a qien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 2 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated for being 22 years old and living in a high risk zone has for two years made a living from agriculture cultivating corn. When her harvest is ready, she sells it in the neighboring villages. She already has many regular customers. The young woman lives in her own house with her family group. 

As she shows in the picture, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicides etc. to be able to continue with her crops, as this is her only source of work, and to have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco con 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo, vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural.Francisco cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Francisco se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad catimor, se dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años y hace 4 años cultiva cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, su producción tendrá como destino al comercializador de café orgánico Alberto Torres, en el Distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Francisco es socio recurrente en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. Francisco firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Francisco, at 31 years old and in a common-law relationship, lives with his partner and son. He lives in his own house made from rustic materials in a rural zone of the Santo Tomás district, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. Francisco has good personal working references from the inhabitants of the area.

Francisco makes a living through agriculture, by cultivating coffee trees, of the catimor variety. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years now and in coffee for 4 years. Additionally he makes a living by raising small animals and growing home products. He has a lot of experience in this line of work and his production has a destination of an organic coffee seller, Alberto Torres, in the Santo Tomas district of Cutervo.

The end use of this loan will be to maintain the aforementioned crops, with which he will have a good yield and higher profits so he can better the quality of life for himself and that of his family.

Francisco is a recurring member in our financial institution Edpyme Alternativa. Francisco signs with his partner.

loans.use: to maintain the aforementioned crops

loans.name: Monron Yama Group

texts.fr: KALEB est l’homme qui tient la corde  du mouton en main  sur la photo. KALEB est un malien,  non alphabétisé, âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de  7 enfants, tous scolarisés.ils sont âgés de 5 à 17 ans, sa femme est une ménagère. KALEB fait d’élevage des ovins, il fait recours au prêt du RMCR afin d’acheter plus de béliers les élever puis les revendre. Il fait ses achats et ses ventes dans les foires de sa localité et environnante. Avec ses bénéfices il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans. KALEB  a comme rêve et   d’avoir beaucoup de profit pour acheter  la  nourriture en suffisance pour sa famille et payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants dans les conditions acceptables.
texts.en:
Kaleb is the man holding the ram in the photo.  He is from Mali, 42 years old, married, illiterate, and the father of seven children (ages 5 to 17) who all attend school.  His wife is a homemaker.  

Kaleb raises sheep.  He is taking a loan from RMCR in order to buy a few additional rams to raise and resell.  He buys and sells his animals at the market in town, or at nearby markets.  Thanks to the profits that the makes, he is able to cover his family's needs and to send his children to school.  He has been involved in this activity for the past ten years.  Kaleb's dream is to increase his profits in order to buy a sufficient amount of food for his family, and also to pay his children's school fees, if the conditions are acceptable.

loans.use: to buy rams to raise and resell.

loans.name: Speedo Group

texts.en:
Anna who is in her mid 50's is married with five children and all are grown up. She has been selling chickens for twenty years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Anna's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She has managed to successfully pay back all her loans. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to buy a plot of land, build a house, built chicken sheds, loan repayments and household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of building another house.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group Speedo which has two members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia Dominga alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes de autos como parabrisas, faros entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the "Padre Urraca" communal bank. She combines her daily activities with working in her business of selling spare parts for cars,  such as windshields, headlights, and more.

She is a responsible, dedicated person who wants to be able to keep working so that she may continue supporting her family.

Dominga is applying for this loan to buy windshields, among other items. She is grateful for this loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy windshields among other items.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 50 years old and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four adult children. Nida has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Nida has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 45 years old. She has six children four of whom are adults, and two are under age.

She has borrowed a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan as well as plough capital back into her business in order to generate additional income.

Her hopes and dream in the future is to pay school fees and expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
LUIS TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y CON SUS 2 HIJOS VIVEN EN LA PARROQUIA GUANUJO  PROVINCIA DE BOLIVAR

Luis SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS, QUINUA Y HABAS ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GANADOS, GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN  LA COMPRA DE UNA VACA MALTONA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO ES  SEGUIR ADELANTE JUNTO CON SUS HIJOS PARA QUE ELLOS TENGAN UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA  SALIR DE PASEO JUNTO CON SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Luis is 24 years old and single. He lives with his wife and two children. They live in the Guanujo parish, Bolivar province.

Luis works in agriculture, planting potatoes, quinoa, and beans, while also raising cattle, chicken, and pigs. This loan has helped him to invest in the purchase of a young cow to increase his production.

His dream is to get his children ahead so that they have a better quality of life.  

In his free time he likes to go out for walks with his children.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим, 29 лет, замужем, многодетная счастливая мама 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Мээрим на сегодняшний день имеет лошадь, 4 коровы, 9 овец, на 3,25 Га земли выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. На ежедневной основе продает молоко, творог, сметану, сливочное масло собственного производства. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем вкладывать в воспитание ее детей, Мээрим с супругом в будущем хотят завести еще четвертого ребенка.
texts.en: Meerim is 29 years old, married, and the happy mother of three children. She has a secondary education. Since 2000 she has been rearing animals and growing crops for income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today Meerim has a horse, four cows, and nine sheep, and she grows wheat and barley on 3.25 hectares of land. She sells the milk, cottage cheese, sour cream, and butter that she produces herself on a daily basis. All this activity brings her a monthly profit of 21,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy four steers for fattening and resale. Meerim plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business in order to have the opportunity to invest in her children's education in future. Meerim and her husband want to have another, fourth, child in future.

loans.use: to buy four young steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old. She is married and has seven children. 

Elizabeth has been keeping poultry as her core business for the last 10 years and it has been profitable. She expanded and now runs a general retail shop where she sells household goods. She has been in this particular business for 1 year now. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of rice, detergents and baking flour for sugar for resale. 

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to wholesale level, and to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, detergents and baking flour for sugar for resale

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that, she is doing her hobby, and she earns an income as well.

At the age of 46 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Josie wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 44 years old and he is married with 4 children. 

He has a retail shop where he sells household goods, and he has been running this business for 5 years now. 

Justus will be using the loan to purchase additional supplies of sugar, salt, cooking oil and flour as new stock for his shop. 

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan and plough back some money into his business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of sugar, salt, cooking oil and flour as new stock for his shop.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Herminia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Rubelie

texts.en:
Rubelie is 25 years old and single with one child. With one child still in school, Rubelie works very hard to provide for them.

Rubelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Rubelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Wilter Isaac

texts.es: Isaac un señor alegre divertido y muy trabajador de 40 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos Isaac de 19 años ,Brillan de 16 que está cursando segundo año de bachillerato y Emiliano de 5 añitos quien  está en su primer añito escolar, él  vive con su esposa y su ultimo hijo, Isaac se dedica  desde hace 9 años a la fabricación de artículos de hierro  acero y aluminio este negocio  ha permitido  que tenga  ingresos y  pueda cubrir las necesidades de su hogar ,brindando educación a sus hijos .con el préstamo comprara materiales para su negocio de esta manera incrementara sus ventas mejorando así  su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Isaac is a happy, funny and hardworking forty-year old man. He is the father of three sons: nineteen-year old Isaac, sixteen-year old Brillan who is in his second year of high school, and five-year old Emiliano, who is in his first year of school. He lives with his wife and his youngest son. 

For the past nine years, Isaac has made his living making objects of iron, steel, and aluminum. This business has allowed him to earn a living and pay for his household necessities, offering education to his son. With this loan, he will buy materials for his business. In this manner, he will increase the earnings from his sales and better his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to fabricate things from iron, steel, and aluminum

loans.name: Luis Byron

texts.es:
LUIS TIENE 18 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO, VIVE CON SUS PAPAS EN LA COMUNIDAD DE BELLAVISTA, PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON GUARANDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR.

Luis SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA Y ADEMAS A LA CAÑA DE AZUCAR TAMBIEN A LA SIEMBRA DE FREJOL, Y CAÑA DE AZUCAR Y A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO , CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN EL INCREMENTO PARA LA SIEMBRA DE LA CAÑA Y FREJOL, NECESARIOS PARA OBTENER UN NIVEL OPTIMO DE PRODUCCION.  

EL SUEÑO ES TENER UN NEGOCIO DE GANADO PARA  MEJORAR  LA CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA JUGAR INDOR FUTBOL CON SU FAMILIA Y ESCALAR LAS BELLAS MONTAÑAS.
texts.en:
Luis is 18 years old, is single, lives with his parents in the Bellavista community, located in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province.

Luis makes a living in agriculture, as well the cultivation of sugar cane and beans and also livestock raising.  

The loan will help him to invest in increasing the sowing areas of the sugar cane and beans, which are necessary to obtain an optimal level of production. 

His dream is to have a cattle business to improve his quality of life.  

In his free time, he likes to play indoor football with his family and to climb the beautiful mountains.

loans.use: NCREMENTO PARA LA SIEMBRA DE LA CAÑA Y FREJOL

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta joined PMPC when she went broke after her first business went bad. To Perfecta, PMPC came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most.

Now, she requests another loan for the next cropping season. She is borrowing an amount for land and seedbed preparation.

Perfecta perseveres and always believe in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Glenda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Glenda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, dried fish, spices, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, dried fish, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Judy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Judy requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 59 years old and widowed with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sonia has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 28-year-old married mother of two children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband works in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, they cannot earn enough for them to afford the cost of their sister’s education. This loan of $ 800 will allow Ana to help her sister graduate from junior high school.She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Ana hopes to send all of her sisters to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila works hard to support two children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Sheila requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Sheila is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Adelino

texts.en: Adelino is a 35-year-old, married father of four children who works hard to support his family. He works for the government and his wife is a housewife. Although the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to support their daughter’s education. This loan of 1,000 USD will allow Adelino to help his daughter to graduate from junior high school and go to university. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies. Adelino loves his daughter very much and hopes that her further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina lives in Same. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $1,000.She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store including aqua, shampoo, candy, books, slippers, candles, pens, detergent, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.Celina is taking this loan because she wants to open her kiosk into a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy aqua, hand body, shampoo, candy, books, slippers, candles, pens, detergent, biscuits, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Clementino

texts.en: Clementino is a 43-year-old married father of one child who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher.Even though the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to afford the cost of their sister’s education. This loan of $1,000 will allow Clementino to help his sister, who will continue her studies until she has graduated from university. She will use the loan to pay for registration and materials for school, because his sister studies far from them. Clementino loves his sister very much and, in the future, Clementino hopes that his sister will be able to work in the government, in agriculture or in a business.

loans.use: to pay for registration and materials for school.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

She supplements this income with earnings from her selling vegetable.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonida dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Luz Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y tienen un molino, juntos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dos están estudiando.

Isabel, trabaja desde muy pequeña, ya que sus padres son agricultores y gracias a ellos aprendió todo lo relacionado a esta actividad; actualmente trabaja con su esposo, sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, pero también tienen un molino y crían ganado de repasto para generar más ingresos. 

El préstamo lo necesita para colocar una tienda y comprar productos de la canasta básica.

Isbael, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel, 37, studied through eight grade. She is married, her husband is a farmer and they own a mill. They have three children, two of whom are students.

She started working when she was very young, her parents are farmers and from them she learned all about this activity. She currently works with her husband planting 7000 square meters of corn, but they also have a mill and they raise grazing cattle to generate more income.

Isabel needs this loan to set up a store and buy basic staples. She dreams of improving her home and bringing a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to set up a store and buy basic staples.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 31 years old and has one child. Katherine is married and has one child still in school.

Katherine is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Katherine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Katherine has been in this business for two years and also has earned additional income from a general store for six years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en: Shafiu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shafiu has the opportunity of attaining yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Shafiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Shafiu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Shafiu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Shafiu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Малика на сегодняшний день имеет 7 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Малика обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Malika is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. To earn income for her family she and her spouse have farmed and raised livestock since the year 2000. Thanks to their tireless work Malika today owns seven sheep. In order to further develop her business Malika has asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a 20,000 som (KGS) loan to buy sheep. She plans to invest income earned from use of the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to expand her herd

loans.name: Sreng's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham Province, Sreng is the group leader of this three-member group. She is 32 years old and the mother of a school-aged child. For more than five years now she has been growing rice to support her family living as well as earning extra money by working in construction. She makes about 10USD a day. This is Sreng’s third loan cycle with VisionFund, and the loans have helped her realize better living conditions. She is now applying for a 4,300,000KHR loan through VisionFund Cambodia to be apportioned among her group members. Recently, Sreng’s rice crop was destroyed by insects, which meant a loss of earnings. She will thus use her share of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to build up her farmland and increase its yield. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to save for future emergencies future.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to build up her farmland and increase its yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en: Ya'u is a maize farmer from Magajin Gari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ya'u is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/hectare, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Ya'u would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ya'u can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ya'u is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. He hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ziramoh

texts.ru: 33 летняя девушка Зирамох. Она еще не замужем и не имеет детей. Зирамох на районе Чиликул живет вместе родителям. Зирамох самостоятельная и заботливая девушка. Она решила заниматься один видом бизнеса. Зирамох продает лепешки и хлеб. У нее имеется постоянные клиенты, которые каждый день покупает 200-300 лепешек на мероприятии. Зирамох вместе матерью занимается в этой сфере деятельности. Ее мама дома печет лепешки, а Зирамох продает их возле рынка. Зирамох решила расширить бизнес. Она хочет взять кредит и приобрести муки и дрова, чтобы запасти. Зирамох знает, что Вы поможете ей, и она обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en: This 33 year old woman is named Ziramoh. She is not married and has no children. Ziramoh lives in the Jilikul region with her parents. She is an independent and attentive person. She's decided to focus on one business - selling bread. She has regular customers who buy 200-300 flatbreads every day for special events. Ziramoh and her mother work together - her mother bakes the bread at home, and Ziramoh sells it at the market. Ziramoh has decided to expand the business. She wants a loan to buy flour and firewood to store. Ziramoh knows that you will help her so she is coming to you for a loan.

loans.use: buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Nasir-Ud-Din

texts.en:
Nasir is married and has three children who attend school. He lives in Karachi. His wife is a housewife looking after the children and house. He owns a general store in the market near his house. He has earned a good reputation among his customers. 

Nasir's business is doing well so he has decided to expand into bakery items, which he believes will do good business as the demand for such items is high. Since his expenses do not leave him with much savings, he requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which he will used to buy bakery items for his shop. He hopes to continue to expand his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase bakery items for his store

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en: Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aliyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Aliyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Aliyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Sabon Layi village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Musa will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to store maize

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years now.

Editha successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Editha would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zorik

texts.en:
Zorik is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Zorik used to work as an electrician, but now he is engaged only in farming. He raises cows, calves, bulls, sheep, pigs, and piglets. 

Zorik he is very skilled and when his wife has some free time she helps him with the sale of their farm products. He sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheeses, curd, and meat. He is also good in land cultivation; on his plot of land he raises potatoes, tomatoes, and greens which he sells right from his farm. 

Zorik would like to develop swine breeding at his farm and he requested a loan, which he will use to buy pigs for his farm and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is married and has children. He operates a bar and the business is doing very well. He also operates coffee and vanilla businesses. His clientele has greatly increased the fact that he is in a very strategic place for business and has good customer care. The challenge is that the drinks are no longer enough and he has little capital compared to the need. 

Moses requested a loan, which he will use to buy more sodas, beers, and spirits to sell. He is a very responsible man who provides for his family needs.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, beers, and spirits to sell

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition.

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nagina has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his rickshaw.

He wants to maintain the engine’s piston and one wheel and he wants to pay for the labor cost for this work. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Nagina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Nagina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for rickshaw repairs and maintenance, including labor costs, for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamdavaa, 30 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a network engineer at a university since 2008. His wife stays at home looking after their children. Their children go to high school.

He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy an electric car in order to render taxi services to local people for extra income. Also, the electric car emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel compared to other engines.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 49-year-old small dried fish trader in Kilifi, Kenya. She is the mother of four whose spouse provides additional income and for the last two years has been doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase sacks of dried fish and the anticipated profit will repay her loan. She hopes to own a big stall for dried fish in future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dried fish.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is 44 years old and lives in Sevan, a city in the Gegharkunik region. He is engaged in farming and agriculture now. For many years he worked at a bread factory, but now he earns his family's living through farming and selling farm products and produce.

On his farm, Gurgen has cows, calves, sheep, a bull and chickens. His farm products for sale are milk, meat, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd and eggs.

Gurgen’s wife greatly helps him with the farm work and cleverly organizes the sale of their farm products and also the produce they harvest, including potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, greens and peppers.

Gurgen is happy to have this farm and the ability to provide his family with fresh farm products. He has a son and a daughter. He is asking for this loan of 700,000 AMD (Armenian drams) as he wants to buy one more cow for his farm to make it richer and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm to make it richer and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en: Obadiah is 56 years old and the father of ten children, four of whom attend school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He rents out part of his land to cocoa growing companies and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He also grows and sells food stuffs like maize, cassava and beans to get more income for the family. He works hard and has plans to educate his children, buy land and expand his cocoa growing. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor, theft and inadequate capital for diversifying into other cash crops like coffee for bigger profits. He wants a loan to pay tuition for his children at various higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 35-year-old sick lady. All her devotions are to her husband who is earning a very low income. Her husband provides services for sheltering for houses under construction. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he is unable to get any contract for sheltering services.

Recently her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Nasreen requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services.

Nasreen is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of raising the loan.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen, 45, is a widow who lives with her two children in the region around Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son works with a company providing sheltering services and is responsible for all of the household’s expenses.

While Noreen’s son has been working as a laborer, he wants to start his own business in the same field. However, due to a lack of working capital he is unable to buy sheltering materials of his own. Therefore, Noreen has applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to buy construction supplies such as bamboo, wooden planks and boards, etc.

Noreen wants to give thanks to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering materials such as bamboo, wooden planks and boards, etc. for her son's construction services

loans.name: Mamman

texts.en:
Mamman is a maize farmer from Sabon Layi village.

As a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization, Mamman is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/hectare, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mamman would have had to sell his maize at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mamman can store his maize and sell it in the future, for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mamman is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Magajin Gari village. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Samaila will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Samaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Samaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dio

texts.en: Dio is a maize farmer from Furana village. As a member of Babban Gona, Dio is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Dio would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dio can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Dio is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone.

As a Babban Gona member, Aminu has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000/hectare, Aminu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Fremark

texts.en:
Fremark is a 24-year-old married man residing in the town of Pilar, Bohol, together with a nine-year-old child. He engages in farming and he grows rice.

He is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his livelihood, but he is also a sacrificing father who deprives himself for the sake of his child.

Fremark has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy fertilizers. With these, he could be able to improve the yield of his farm and slowly augment his income.

In the future, Fremark would like to expand his farming livelihood to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 41 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh, a village in the Gegharkunik region. Aida has no specialty and she has never been employed, but she is a very good and skilled farmer, having started at a very young age.

Aida is married, and she lives with her husband, son and daughter (she is a student). Aida has a big farm where she takes care of cows, calves, heifers, bulls, a horse and chickens. She organizes the sale of her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd, and eggs and also her land’s produce, including potatoes, peppers, tomatoes and garlic.

She mentions that since her husband has no constant work, farming is the best way for sustaining her family's needs. Now with her Kiva loan, Aida wants to buy two heifers, a calf, and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, a calf, and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 57 years old and does quarry business, making building blocks and stones to sell. She is married and is blessed with six children. She has been in this business for the last eight years.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to pay for transportation of the building blocks and stones and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

She plans to use the generated profits to provide for the needs of her family. Her future hopes are to have a successful business and to be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to pay for transportation of building blocks and stones; she hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Awenpo

texts.en:
Awenpo is a 47-year-old single woman and stays alone. She sells groundnuts, fruits and second-hand clothing. She has been doing this for nine years, through hawking from door to door.

Awenpo became a member of ID Ghana in March 2010, to gain access to capital for her business. She needs a loan to buy groundnuts, fruits and second-hand clothing to sell to customers. The profits will be used to pay for household expenses and for expanding the work.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, fruits and second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 47-year-old, widowed mother of one child, who has been working from her house, selling clothes and shoes.

Her beloved husband was her main supporter. He encouraged her to start a business of her own which she proved to be skilled in. She started her current business in 2003 and is working hard to develop it since she is her child's sole breadwinner and she wants to make her dream of expanding her business come true.

Huda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise through purchasing newly released autumn and winter clothes collections.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise through purchasing newly released autumn and winter clothes collections.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos con 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa de sus padres,en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica al cultivo de café, hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de abonos,con la compra de abonos realizará mejoras en su cultivo y con esto incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Santos es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Santos is 27 years old. He is single and lives at home with his parents in Cañaris district , located in Ferreñafe province , which is in the Lambayeque region of Perú. The majority of people in this area make a living from agriculture, small business and rearing cattle.



Santos has made a living from growing coffee for more than ten years. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve his crop thereby increasing the crop yield.


Santos is an established member of our partner Edpyme Alternativa; he has repaid prior loans on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco is married, with children. He deals in alcohol distilling, commonly known as waragi. Through this business, he has been able to buy a taxi for his transport business.

Johnbosco now desires to build himself a residential house, however, he lacks some money to meet his budget.

He requests money to buy the construction materials he lacks, like cement, sand, and timber.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and timber.

loans.name: Ahmadu

texts.en: Ahmadu is a maize farmer from Chino Village in Nigeria. As a member of Babban Gona, Ahmadu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmadu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmadu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ahmadu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Barnohon

texts.ru:
Барнохон 55 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать троих детей. Сыновьям 33, 19 и 17 лет. Барнохон серьезная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она много лет занимается земледелием.   
В этом году Барнохон посадила морковь. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Барнохону надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. Но на такое количество удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян морковь. И после сбора урожай Барнохон хочет еще посадить морковь.  Она верит, что Вы внесете вклад в получение урожая. Она верит в Вас и Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Barnohon is 55 years old. She is a married woman, and the mother of 3 children. Her sons are 33, 19, and 17 years old. Barnohon is a serious and hard-working woman. She has been farming for many years.

This year, Barnohon planted carrots. There is still some time left until she collects her harvest. Right now, Barnohon needs to work her soil with mineral fertilizer. She plans to have a good and rich harvest, so she wants to buy good-quality, tested fertilizer. However, she does not have enough money for the amount of fertilizer she needs.

Barnohon is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and carrot seeds. After she collects her harvest, Barnohon wants to plant carrots again. She believes that you will invest in the creation of her harvest. She trusts in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy good-quality mineral fertilizer and carrot seeds.

loans.name: Oscar Lino

texts.es:
Oscar es reconocido por sus vecinos como una persona responsable y muy amable. Desde muy pequeño fue alguien muy curioso por la realidad y la forma en que las personas actúan. A sus treinta años d edad es padre de cuatro hijos, esposo de una mujer que lo apoya en tanto en su negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios, como moralmente y estudia de modalidad sabatina la licenciatura en Psicología. 
El ayudar a las personas en el campo de la salud mental, fue una de las principales características que le motivó a estudiar esta carrera, la cual está a punto de coronar. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y así culminar su carrera, ampliando sus oportunidades de trabajo en el campo estudiado. En sus planes está obtener su título universitario y hacer crecer el negocio de la tienda.
texts.en:
Oscar is known by his neighbors as a responsible and very friendly person. Since he was very young, he was someone who was curious about reality and the way people act. At 30 years old, he is the father of four children, and the husband of a woman who supports him just as much in his business of clothing and accessories sales as she does morally. On Saturdays he goes to school for psychology courses.

Helping people in the mental health field was one of the main features that motivated him to study this major, which is about to reach its highest point. For this reason he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree finalization course and with that end his college career, increasing his work opportunities in the field he studied. Obtaining his university degree and growing his store business are in his plans.

loans.use: to pay for his degree finalization course.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a maize farmer from Chino Village, Nigeria. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ishaku will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ishaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ishaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.en:
Maria Lina is a 39-year-old widow woman who earns a living with a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods, which she has used to manage the economy of her house. She has her own property where she lives with her 2 year son.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI, to buy assorted stocks like beverages, seasonings, noodles, soft drinks and chips. She used the previous loan to stock her shop and wants to continue doing so.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks like beverages, seasonings, noodles, soft drinks and chips

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en: Grisha lives in Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik Region of Armenia. He lives with his two sons. His daughter is already married, and she lives with her family. Grisha has a farm with cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep and lambs. Grisha specializes in selling meat, and from the farm he sells a lot of beef, pork and mutton. He sells some milk and cheese to his customers, which are his neighbors. Grisha also sells potatoes to re-sellers right from his farm. With his first Kiva loan, Grisha would like to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Kabale-Ntara Parishes Coffee Producers Organisatio Group

texts.en: Gertrude is a 43-year-old married woman with 7 seven children aged between 10 and 26 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in goat fattening where she sells to the butchers to earn a living. With the proceeds, she has been able to earn a living and pay school fees for her children. Apart from that, she also practices farming, from which she gets food and earns money to support her family. She hopes that in the future, she will own a well-known goats farm, though she is challenged by inadequate capital to meet the high demand and weather changes that prevent goats from growing fat and also stop customers to turn up. Gertrude intends to use the loan to buy more goats for sale. She is a member of Kabale-Ntara Parishes Coffee Producers Organization where each member guarantees the other.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Muhamudu

texts.en:
Muhamudu is has three children and is a hardworking man. He also takes care of five other dependents whose parents are deceased. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda where he is a farmer, mainly growing cocoa. Due to the seasonality nature of farming, he also operates a restaurant in order to earn a daily income. He is widely known for his delicious local foods by the locals. 

Muhamudu requested a loan, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to educate his children up to university while his business desire is to own a hotel in town.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nuhu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

Nuhu requested a loan, which he will use to store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Nuhu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to store his maize

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children, ages 25, 22, 16 ,13 and 9 years old. She has had a retail business for 20 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. She is borrowing KES. 60,000 from Visionfund Kenya as her third loan, after paying the previous loan successful.

She will be using the loan to purchase retail goods. Therefore she hopes that the anticipated profit will help her buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, save some savings in her personal account, cater for medical care, expand the current business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established retail business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Sevan in Armenia’s Gegharkunik region. While Gohar is qualified to teach elementary school, she is employed in another capacity. Her husband works at a gas station.

Gohar has applied for a 700,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy a tombstone for her father who died a year ago. She would be very grateful for Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy a tombstone for her father who died a year ago.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Adamu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Adamu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a Babban Gona farmer. Samuel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Samuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Samuel can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Samuel has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Samuel is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Meimuna

texts.en:
Meimuna is a married mother of three children, all in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan Meimuna is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 27-year-old quarry worker in Kilifi, Kenya. She is a mother of one. She has been in this business for the last year and is doing well.

This is her second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to pay for transport. The anticipated profit will be used to repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for transport

loans.name: Cherihan

texts.en: Cherihan is a 20-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. She works from her house where she provides hairdressing and beautician services. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her training courses in hairdressing. She said that, after taking the loan, she will be able to attract more customers, and therefore, increase her income and develop her way of living.

loans.use: to pay for her training courses in hairdressing.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and three children. She is a very hardworker who strives to work under pressure in order to live a respectable life. She spent the last fifteen years in her bakery, preparing delicious manakich and bread. She is well known in her town and people visit her from all over the neighboring areas. She always wanted to better develop her business and improve her work. For that reason, she decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise such as flour and oil. She confirms that the loan will help her increase her sales and thus her income.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 46, is married and has five children. Her husband works at construction sites. Unfortunately, he does not make enough to support his family. Subsequently, Elizabeth has identified an opportunity to create revenue and help raise her children.

She is part of a self-help group that has purchased greenhouses and is growing crops for sale. With a Kiva loan, Esther will buy organic seedlings as well as fertilizer to work on her greenhouse. The revenue generated will be used to buy more products and eventually create a sustainable system.

loans.use: to buy organic seedlings and fertilizer.
