He is grown up and independent. Shirmo makes "chakka" at home. "Chakka" is a type of traditional strained youghurt made from milk. Shirmo prepares chakka for sale locally. This is a good business for her.

Shirmo would like to expand and increase her income. She needs funds to buy milk. This is why she is asking for your help. She puts her trust in you.

loans.use: to buy milk for preparing traditional strained yougurt.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 41 year old man. He is married to a loving wife and they have two young kids, a nine-year-old and a four-year-old. Roberto works hard everyday in order to secure a good future for his family. He makes a living by a running a stationery store. This is no common stationery store, because of the vast variety of products that Roberto offers in his store. He sells clothes, notebooks, pencils, pens, paint, and various other stationery products. He also rents computers. If someone is in need of a computer to print or work on a last minute file his computers are available. 

Roberto feels like his stationery store is running low on products to offer and fears that some of his computers are not working as they should. Therefore he is looking for a 10,000 MXN loan which will allow him to get a larger inventory and fix some problems with his computers. Roberto is a special client for Kubo because he lacks a formal credit history. This is the reason why some other institutions haven't provided loans to him. Kubo would like to help him along with Kiva to create a serious credit history.

loans.use: To renew the stock of his store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Grace. She is married and has no children. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is helping to educate him.

In 2012, Grace established her provisions business. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are the general public. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 8,00,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Grace requires a loan in order to purchase more cartons of milk, sugar, baby milk, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, etc., for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to improve her living standards and increase her earnings.

In the future, Grace plans to buy a plot of land and build a house. The challenges she faces in her business are financial constraints and the cost of goods increasing in the market due to the inflation of prices.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of milk, sugar, baby milk, and Ovaltine.

loans.name: Bertha Germania

texts.es: Germania alegre, entusiasta tiene 30 años es madre soltera tiene una niña de 9 años Tania estudia  en una escuela gratuita del sector donde viven, Ella es estilista empezó desde los 15 años a trabajar como operaria,  el malestar de sentirse explotada laboralmente hizo que  decida emprender su pequeño salón de belleza. Germania trabaja desde muy temprano hasta la noche tratando de ganar clientes, Ella necesita el dinero para comprar algunos instrumentos de belleza,  espejos, sillas y productos que facilitarían su trabajo generaría más ganancias para poder alimentar, educar a su pequeña e idealizar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Germania is a happy, enthusiastic 30 year old. She is the single mother of a 9 year old daughter, Tania who studies in a free school in the area where they live. She is a stylist who at the age of 15 started to work as an worker. The discomfort of feeling exploited in her work made her decide to start her own beauty salon.

Germania works from very early until night trying to gain clients. She needs money to buy some beauty salon instruments, mirrors, chairs and products that will facilitate her work generating more profit to be able to feed and educate her young one and idealize her own house.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon instruments.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is married and applying for a loan of $ 1000.00. She has a kiosk and her husband is in agriculture. She started with an small store, so she is taking this loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sardines, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, water, candles, cigarettes, candies, soft drinks and hard drinks and other items to sell.  She started her business in 2005 with a working capital of $ 600.00. She hopes to open a big store in the future, with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy sardines, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, water, candles, cigarettes, candies, soft drinks and hard drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.en:
The eight clients of “Trabajadoras Group”, or “Worker Women” Trust Bank live in the beautiful town of San Juan La Laguna, beside Lago Atitlán, a beautiful lake in the Western part of Guatemala. With a mainly indigenous Mayan population,“Tz'utujil” is the spoken language among these women in addition to Spanish.

Dominga is the youngest member of the group at 22 years of age, and she is the president! With a secondary school education through the age of 17 and the determination and motivation that she possesses, Dominga already has her own convenience store in San Juan La Laguna. Married, with a husband who is a labourer, she is not only a businesswoman, but a mother as well, raising her little six-month-old son. Dominga is very busy taking care of her baby and managing her store, but she feels very supported, happy and motivated in the midst of this challenge as a Friendship Bridge client.

Dominga plans to invest her Kiva loan in products for her store to satisfy her customers' demand for sugar, rice, beans, soda, and corn. With the help of this credit, she hopes to expand her store.

Dominga intends to continue with Friendship Bridge, as an active participant in the programs it offers her and as an enthusiastic member of her Trust Bank. She is thankful for this opportunity to grow with her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy products for her store to satisfy her customers' demand for sugar, rice, beans, soda and corn.

loans.name: Pelaria

texts.en: Pelaria is 60 years old. Even at her age, she does not rely on her grown children to provide for her. Instead, she cooks bingka (rice cake) and makes tabliya (chocolate from roasted cacao seeds). Tabliya is a famous food used to make hot chocolate. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as yeast, coconut and sugar. Pelaria's income is used for savings, food and school fees of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to  buy yeast, coconut and sugar

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 57 years old and married with seven children. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, , milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Tamba Joseph

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Tamba. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 4. In 2003, Tamba established his local food stuff business. He began his business because he was dropped out of school, so he decided to set up his own business in order to take care of himself and his family. 

His business is located in outskirts, and his main customers are the market women. Working 6 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Tamba requires a loan in order to purchase 50 bags of gari for resale.   

He hopes that this loan will help to maximise profit and to cater to more customers. In the future, Tamba plans to finish his building project at Calaba Town and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of gari for resale

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltero porque hace unos años se separo de su esposa, tiene dos hijos y trabajan para mantenerse y viven con él.

Salvador, compra y vende  ganado desde hace 7 años, este negocio lo aprendió con su padre cuando le ayudaba en su casa, pero también trabaja en una hacienda limpiando los cultivos; anteriormente trabajo como seguridad pública y su horario es desde 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Salvador, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas pequeñas, para desarrollarlas y poder venderlas cuando ya estén más grandes y tengan un precio más alto.

Sueña con comenzar de nuevo con el negocio de ganado, pues es algo que su padre le enseño y espera que sus hijos también aprendan, para que en un futuro tengan buenos negocios.
texts.en:
Salvador is 51 years old and studied up to Grade 2. He is single as he separated from his wife a few years ago. He has two children who live with him and he works to support them.

Salvador has been buying and selling cattle for 7 years. He learned this trade from his father when he helped him with his house. He also works on a farm cleaning the crops. He works from 7am until 3 pm.

Salvador needs the loan to buy two small cows to raise them and be able to sell them when they are big and have a higher value.

He dreams of starting in the cattle business again as it is something that his father taught him and he hopes that his children also learn so that in the future they can do good business.

loans.use: to buy two small cows.

loans.name: Laura Edith

texts.en:
Laura is a woman in her late 30's. She is single and lives with her parents. She likes to live there to be available to take care of them, and provide them with financial support. Laura makes a living by working for a small enterprise as an assistant. She enjoys cooking and travelling.

Laura wants to see both of her parents living in the best place as possible. They are owners of their house so Laura wants to make this house as comfortable as possible. To make it suitable she wants to make some repairs, so she is applying for a 10,527 MXN loan at Kiva, through Kubo.financiero, Kiva's field partner. With this loan she would be able to repaint the walls and change some broken windows and improve the quality of life for her parents.

loans.use: to fix small details of her house

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano 2” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder mejorar y poder crecer.
Silveria es una de las que integra este grupo, ella tiene una huerta en la que planta todo tipo de hortalizas que después sale a vender, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por su familia ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ella paso.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de semillas abonos y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus cultivos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Cayetano 2” was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Santaní who joined together. All of the members have developed their own independent business activities, but they still help one another so that they can improve and grow.

Silveria is one of the members of this group. She has a garden where she plants all types of vegetables that she eventually sells. Silveria is a hardworking individual who strives to provide her family with everything that she was not able to have. She hopes that her family can avoid the hardships that she had to experience.

Silveria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of seeds, compost, and other supplies. This will allow her to continue cultivating her crops just as before.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old John. He is married and has three children, aged 18, 16 and 1 year.

In 2005, John established his pharmacy drugs/medicine business. He began his business because his salary was not enough as a trained pharmacist, so he set up a business to raise more money for his family.

His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are all classes of people. Working six days a week and 18 hours a day, he earns about SLL 7,00,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. John requires a loan in order to buy different types of drugs/medicine for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to maximize profit and to cater to more customers.

From his additional money, he is planning in the future to construct a clinic on four plots of land he bought six miles along the highway. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in wood sculptures. He would like to purchase raw materials and tools, including wood, paint, sandpaper, and chisels, as well as hire two additional carvers for his workshop.

Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

Born in Chichicastenango, Guatemala, Jose learned his craft from his father. "When I was younger he would only allow me to sand a piece, and as I got older he would let me paint, too. It wasn't until I was older that he'd finally let me carve the wood. I remember well the first piece I ever did completely on my own: an angel. I put it among the things my father took to the market to sell, and then I lost track of it! I hope it got sold to someone who appreciated it because at the time I was only an apprentice.

"I am very grateful for the assistance this microcredit provides. The local sales have been very slow at my store, so working via the Internet has really helped my business and allowed me to continue making a living by creating the art that I love."

Use the link below to view Jose's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7485

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and tools, and to hire two additional carvers for his workshop.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia sells snack food in the nearby school in her place. She sells ice candy, banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), hot cake and puto (steamed rice). Aside from food vending she raises and sells pigs.
She is married with eleven children. Three of her children are still attending school.
She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her snack food business and pig feed. This loan will boost her livelihood and improve her daily earnings.

In the future Remegia is hoping that she can increase the productivity for the welfare of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack food business and pig feed.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a married woman and has three children, ages 9, 12, and 15. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store located in front of her house which serves as the family's main source of income. She sells basic household items like noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, eggs, vegetables, cooking oil, starch, shampoo, and toothpaste. She is 41 years old and her husband is a farmer.

Dominga decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 7,000 PHP loan, she wants to buy assorted groceries such as energy drinks, soft drinks, canned goods, and toiletries.

Dominga is certain that with your support, she can improve her family's living conditions and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries such as energy drinks, soft drinks, canned goods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy lives in Valencia, Bohol. She is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two kids, ages 1 and 2. Aside from taking care of her children, Joy runs a sari-sari (general) store and a hog raising business. These businesses are easier to manage than others since they are located in her house. She sells items like canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, chips, detergent, coffee, and insect repellent. She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, rice, cigarettes, drinks, feed, piglets, and fertilizer. Joy dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, cigarettes, drinks, feed, piglets, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Monamie

texts.en:
Monamie is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Monamie is 25 years old.

Monamie has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Monamie requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Monamie has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sinclair

texts.en:
Sinclair is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African wood masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish.

Sinclair has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"As I was growing up, I used to carve some in school, but little did I know that I would one day become a woodcarver. I moved to Accra to live with my dad. At the time, my father was into carving and had been asking to me to join him in his workshop, but I wasn't interested. I once visited him at work and he asked me to help with some masks. To his surprise, I finished earlier than his apprentice and did a good job. My dad sold the masks and gave me a commission. That convinced me. I quit my job as a gardener and started assisting my father. Eventually, I went to a master carver to learn how to carve other items and also to improve on my skills. In my designs I look out for accuracy and good imagination and creativity. I get inspiration from my environment and the people around me. My hope and plans for the future include establishing a workshop in my hometown and starting a tree farm and a fish farm to help the youth there have a source of income.

"Without your help, our dreams could never come to pass. I thank you so much for helping me through this loan. God bless you all."

Use the link below to view Sinclair's hand-carved African wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8792

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive en la ciudad de Santaní, es una joven estudiante muy dedicada a su carrera, la cual es de enfermería, y por medio de sus estudios busca poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella es una joven que busca un mejor porvenir para ella y para los que quiere. Anhela poder tener su título, y al terminar la carrera poder seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura lives in the city of Santaní. She is a young student who is very dedicated to her course of study, which is nursing, and through her studies she seeks to be able to help other people.

She is a young person who seeks a better future for herself and for those she loves. She longs to obtain her degree and, upon finishing her program, to be able to continue studying.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor con 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en casa propia, de material rústico, en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Francisco cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Victor se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café, hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de abonos, con la compra de abonos realizará mejoras en su cultivo y con eso incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Victor es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado cuatro créditos los cuáles lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Victor is 41 years old and in a civil union. He lives with his partner and children in their house made of rustic materials, located in the district of Cañaris, the province of Ferreñafe, the department of Lambayeque, in the country of Perú. He has very good personal references and employment history in the area.

Victor has made a living cultivating coffee for more than 10 years. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer. With this purchase he wants to realize improvements in his cultivation and an increase in his crop yields.

Victor is a recurrent partner with the our institution "Edpyme Alternativa", from which he utilized four loans and paid off in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizer. With the purchase of fertilizer he can realize improvements in his cultivation.

loans.name: Anesty

texts.en:
Anesty is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anesty is 26 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Anesty has a rice-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Anesty has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 55 years old and widowed with eight children, one of whom still in school. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, and other items. Belinda has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 37 years old and married with one child. Pinky works very hard to provide for her family.

Pinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Pinky has been in this business for four years. In the future, Pinky would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rea Joy

texts.en:
Rea Joy is a married woman with three children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rea Joy is 30 years old.

Rea Joy has a direct-selling business in the Philippines. Rea Joy requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her business, such as roll-ons, beauty soap, body lotion, and other personal care products.

Rea Joy has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her business, such as roll-ons, beauty soap, body lotion, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Give And Get - N13Thòaqnham Group

texts.en:
Tính is 52 years old and married. Tính lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because this area is often affected by natural disasters such as floods and storms.

The main hardship that Tính faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. In 2014, Tính joined Thanh Hoa to improve her business. Since then, her income has increased significantly.

She is the group leader of "Give and Get - N13THòaqnham," which consists of five members. In the future, Tính hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 34 years old and married with three children who are presently in school, Rosalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Rosalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from her general store.

Evangeline is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional sewing machine for the expansion of her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Jorge Abelardo

texts.es:
Jorge, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero, trabaja como promotor de salud y vive con sus padres.

Jorge, ha trabajado desde los 12 años de edad, ya que su padre es agricultor y él lo acompañaba en sus tiempos libres a ayudarle y gracias a eso aprendió a sembrar maíz y frijol.- Actualmente, tiene 3 años de trabajar como promotor de salud, él es una persona con vocación de servicio y por eso su trabajo le apasiona, porque siempre esta al servicio de los habitantes de su comunidad.

Jorge, está solicitando el préstamo para colocar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, con lo cual estará ayudando a que su familia tenga una nueva fuente de ingreso.

Jorge, sueña con tener su casa propia y le gustaría continuar sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27 years old, he studied through high school and is single. He works as a health promoter and lives with his parents.

Jorge has worked since he was 12 years old, since his father is a farmer and Jorge accompanied him in his free time to help him, and thanks to this he learned how to plant corn and beans. He currently has been working for three years as a health promoter. He is a person with a service profession, and because of this his job enlivens him since he is at the service of the people in his community.

Jorge is requesting a loan to set up a store selling products from the basic food basket, with which he will be helping his family have a new source of income. Jorge dreams of having his own house, and he would like to continue studying in the university.

loans.use: to set up a store selling products from the basic food basket.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo and etc. Gloria has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jenel

texts.en:
Jenel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenel is 33 years old and all three of her children attend school.

Jenel has a rice-selling business in the Philippines. Jenel has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.Jenel has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 41 años de edad, no pudo estudiar porque su familia vivía en extrema pobreza, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica al trabajo de campo, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija no estudia debido que tiene una discapacidad especial.

Julia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 13 años de edad, ella posee dos terneras con las cuales espera aumentar su hato, ella actualmente trabaja en la agricultura porque es de donde obtiene los ingresos, para poder sostener a su familia, la parcela donde siembra está a 20 minutos de su casa y viaja a pie.- Su hija mayor la acompaña porque no tiene con quien dejarla mientras ella trabaja, con ella también trabaja su pareja, ellos se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno para llevar y regresan a casa a las 2:00 p.m.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una novilla.

El sueño de Julia, es poder dejarle a su hija una casa digna, para que pueda vivir cuando ella no este y poder ver a su hijo como profesional.
texts.en:
Julia, who is 41 years old, was not able to go to school because her family lived in extreme poverty. She is married, and her husband does farm work. She has two children, ages 13 and 10. Her oldest daughter doesn't go to school because she has a special disability.

Julia has worked in agriculture since she was 13 years old. She has two calves with which she hopes to increase her herd. She now works in agriculture because it is where she obtains her income in order to be able to support her family. The parcel [of land] that she plants is 20 minutes from her house and she travels on foot. Her older daughter accompanies her because she doesn't have anyone to leave her with while she works. Her husband also works with her. She gets up at 4:00 am to prepare breakfast to take along, and they return to the house at 2:00 pm.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy a heifer.

Julia's dream is to be able to leave her daughter a dignified house where she can live when she [Julia] is not here and to be able to see her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, 36, is a mother blessed with five children living in Preah Vihear province. She earns income to improve her family’s quality of life by growing rice and selling handicraft.

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund and she has paid back her past loans completely. Her past loans helped her improve her family's living conditions. She is the group leader in a group of two seeking this loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for her family’s home. She wishes for good health for her family and wants to protect her all beloved children from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to provide her family a better living condition and to protect her all beloved children from infectious diseases.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Race Of Fishes - N06Tđôngqnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáu is 32 years old, and she is married. 

She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Sáu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So, her income is unstable.

The main hardship that Sáu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2008, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Sáu has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "Race of fishes - N06TĐôngQNham," which consists of five members.

In the future, Sáu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 47 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. Ma. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Liza runs a general store in the Philippines, She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc. Ma. Liza has been in this business for 4 years.

Ma. Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 40 years old and married with two children.

Rosanna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Rosanna has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming corn and E-loading.

Rosanna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Abra  Akofa

texts.fr: Mariée et  âgée de 29 ans, Abra est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Abra est une revendeuse des oignons et gingembres qui  s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Vue les besoins de sa clientèle, Abra sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs d’oignons afin de satisfaire aux demandes de ses clients et gagner plus de profit ; ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux épargner en vue d’aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer puis soutenir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abra is 29 years old and married.  She lives in Adidogomé and she has one child under her care.  Abra buys and sells onions and ginger.  She buys her merchandise at the market twice a month, and then resells her goods from home as well as in the surrounding neighborhoods.  Abra is taking this loan to purchase some bags of onions in order to meet the demand from her customers.  Thanks to this loan, she will increase her profits and save more money.  She will also be able to help her husband cover the family's expenses and take care of the children's education.

loans.use: to buy three bags of onions.

loans.name: Marylin

texts.en:
Marylin is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marylin has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like eggs, peanut, rice, sugar, etc. for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marylin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like eggs, peanuts, rice, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: 3 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “3 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el trigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de enaguas, venta de estuco, venta de dulces y galletas, venta de joyas, venta de jugos, venta de juguetes, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que hace diecinueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace veinte años, por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de joyas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “3 de Octubre” (October 3rd) is in its 37th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Teresa serves as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling petticoats, selling stucco, selling candy and cookies, selling jewelry, selling juices, selling toys, and selling food.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Teresa. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 19 years ago after receiving an invitation from an advisor from the organization. Teresa currently has a business in which she sells jewelry. She has become knowledgeable about this type of business since she started it on her own 20 years ago.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying jewelry in bulk. She acquires her inventory from the sellers in the city of El Alto and then offers it for sale from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family financially. Teresa is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teresa said that she enjoys the training seminars and the health services.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Remar

texts.en:
Remar from Guimbal, Iloilo is busy with his enterprises: a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells usual commodities and a tricycle that transport passengers within their community. His loving wife and business partner, Charol, supports him in all his undertakings. They exert best efforts for the sake of their children who are still in elementary level. In times that Remar is driving his tricycle, his wife looks after the store while taking care of their children. They don’t stop thinking about the possible ways on how to enhance their trade. As much as possible, they want to prepare early for their children’s future.

Now he plans to purchase extra supplies for his variety store in order to gain higher profit. He applies for PHP 20,000 loan for this purpose. Part of the loan will be used to buy spare parts of his tricycle. He aspires that in due time all his undertakings will reward the whole family with a comfortable life, good career for his children, and a house and lot. 

Remar is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and he regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase extra supplies for his variety store

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby.In addition she also operates a coconut selling business that earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti  is a married with three school going children. They live at their own house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Ama est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Ama vit à Adidogomé et vend des plats, bassines et sceaux en plastiques à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant pour  gagner son revenu. Ama s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de bassines en plastiques en vue de bien revendre et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et avoir un épanouissement.
texts.en: Ama is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She lives and works in Adidogomé.  She makes a living selling plastic dishes, bowls, and buckets from her home and as an itinerant seller in the surrounding neighborhoods.  She stocks up twice a month at the market.  She is taking this loan to buy several dozen plastic bowls.  Her goal is to increase her sales and to make enough money to help her husband cover the costs of the children's education and to find her own professional fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy three dozen plastic bowls.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lida es de la ciudad de Santaní, gracias al préstamo anterior de kiva pudo cubrir sus gastos de titulacion, y hoy ya es una profesional recibida, continua con sus estudios, y esta haciendo un postgrado en didáctica universitaria, lo que la habilitará a poder enseñar en las universidades.
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibió que le fue de mucha ayuda, y agradece de vuelta por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su postgrado para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Lida is from the city of Santaní. Thanks to the previous loan from Kiva, she was able to pay the expenses for her degree, and today she is already a professional graduate. She is continuing with her studies and doing a graduate degree in university education, which will enable her to to be able to teach at the universities. She is thankful for this opportunity that she received, which was a great help to her, and she is again thankful for this new opportunity that she is receiving. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in paying her graduate school fees and to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her graduate school fees

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married with children.She does tailoring as her only source of income. By doing this, she is able to provide for her family needs. She is a hard working woman which can be proved by the way she is progressing in business. She was working for some one, and through her salary savings, she managed to buy her own  tailoring machine. She has capacity to do even better but is faced with a challenge of limited capital.She requests for credit to buy a variety of clothing  materials for sewing and selling so that she can attract more customers to her business and hence increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing  materials for sewing and selling

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a very hard working lady who is tasked to take responsibility of 3 children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda.She deals in textile mostly selling clothes for both men and women. She supplements it with incomes from owning rentals. She dreams of growing and expanding her business the more and look for the latest designs only to be limited by inadequate capital. Christine is seeking for a loan facility to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling household meat goat at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati  is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Musha Mukadzi Group

texts.en:
As the vein of forked lights illuminate through her counter in the sunshine suburb of Chitungwiza, Shamiso will be already behind the counter of her small grocery shop. She started her business in 2010. Although Shamiso faced cumbersome situations as a single mother of two, especially in paying school fees for her children. All this did not confine her abilities but instead it molded her to a strong and courageous businesswoman.

Despite the stiff competition in the grocery business, Shamiso’s products are comparably designed in a titivating way in terms of pricing and appearance which makes the surrounding people in her neighborhood favor her shop. Moreso, the other attracting force to customers is her great personality which helps her to build loyalty and a high retention rate. However, she is constantly facing capital constraints as she recently opened another grocery shop at a very busy Shopping mall. She came to Thrive Microfinance together with her friends in business as a group called Musha Mukadzi and they benefited from training especially on record-keeping. She needs $300 to attain her desired level of stocking.

loans.use: to restock her new grocery shop.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El señor Luciano es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene casa propia, es casado, y tiene hijos. Él se dedica a la venta de carbón y a la agricultura, su señora se dedica a la cría de animales, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y honesto, empezó a vender su producto en un carrito, su sueño de siempre era de tener una camioneta pero no pudo comprar, entonces compro para su carreta con dos caballo, ese es su medio de transporte en ese se moviliza por toda la zona para vender su producto.
 Solicita este préstamo para compra de envases para carbón, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Luciano is from the city of Santaní. He is a homeowner, is married, and has children. Luciano sells charcoal and also engages in farming. His wife raises animals. Both of them help one another so that they can get ahead.

Luciano is a hardworking, responsible, and honest man. He began selling his product from a small cart. His dream was always to have a truck, but he was not able to buy one. Since that time, he purchased a cart that is pulled by two horses. With this mode of transportation, he is able to travel throughout the area in order to sell his product.

Luciano is requesting this loan so that he can buy packing containers for his charcoal. This will enable him to continue his sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy packing containers for selling charcoal.

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
Efren es un joven muy dedicado al estudio, le gusta la carrera que está estudiando ya que desde pequeño siempre quiso ser médico.
Él vive con sus padres, y comenta que desea sobresalir profesionalmente a través de los logros obtenidos. Su meta es tener su título y poder trabajar en una institución pública y montar su propio consultorio, enseñar en las Universidades así ayudar a los jóvenes para ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Efren is a young man who is very dedicated to his education. Ever since he was a little boy he has always wanted to be a doctor.

He lives with his parents and wants to excel professionally through his achievements. His goal is to have his degree and be able to work in a public institution, as well as start his own practice. He would also like to teach in universities and help young people succeed in life.

He is asking for this loan so that he can pay his school fees and continue with his education.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de concentrado y asi seguir con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She has been farming and raising pigs for the past 15 years. Maria sells her products in the neighboring towns. With the income she earns from her sales, Maria is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy concentrated feed. As a result, she can continue raising pigs and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Selling different food dishes and other food products was a very good choice of business for Marcelina, since the most basic needs of customers are found in her store. Aside from this, she is able to supply the daily necessities of her family because of the income she accumulates from the inventory.

With her full-blown potential in business handling, she is confident enough to borrow a loan worth
PHP 39,000 which she will use to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her business. Though she's only started with this industry a year ago, she assures you she will repay faithfully with all that she can. She also had availed several loans from CCT that were used to improve her variety store which is still operating now.

Today, she is really striving enough to save money for future purposes. She wants the best for her family. At the same time, she's looking forward for the success of her businesses.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and raw products for her business.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Oñondivepa  está en su ciclo número 1 º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas se esfuerzan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marlene, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y por medio de este trabajo se gana los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una persona luchadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de si para poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene hacienda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group “Oñondivepa” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to succeed. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can strive to improve their living conditions by working together.

One of the members is Sra. Marlene, who sells cosmetics. Through this line of work, she has the means to help her family and loved ones. Marlene is a determined individual who wants to get ahead. Therefore, she is doing everything she can to improve.

Marlene is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various cosmetics to sell. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Maricel has been in his business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 44 years old and married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marjorie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Marjorie requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Delita

texts.en:
Delita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es:
Filas de sacos de masas decoran la casa de Ada, una emprendedora de cincuenta años de edad que se siente muy feliz de haber solicitado el préstamo anterior, con el cual compró maiz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, entre otros. Por lo que quiere agradecer a todas las personas que le apoyaron en ese préstamo que le trajo buenos ingresos.
Actualmente Ada quiere volver a invertir en su negocio de molino, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más masa, bolsas, carne, verdura y para darle mantenimiento a su molino, materiales que le permitirán mantener el negocio de molino y nacatamales activo. Al cancelar pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus cuatro hijos, como le ha apoyado a ella siendo madre soltera.
texts.en:
Rows of sacks of masa decorate Ada's house. She's a 50-year-old entrepreneur who's very happy about requesting her previous loan. She bought corn, chiltoma peppers, onions, tomatoes, and other products, for which she wants to thank everyone who supported her with a loan that earned her a good income.

Currently Ada wants to invest in her mill business again, so she's requesting a new loan to buy more masa, bags, meat, and vegetables, and to provide maintenance on her mill. These materials will allow her to stimulate her mill and nacatamal business.

When she pays it back she plans to keep investing in her business and supporting her four children, because it has helped her as a single mother.

loans.use: to buy more masa, bags, meat, vegetables, and bread, and to perform maintenance on her mill

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Margaret's business was able to generate better revenue, and she entered into the business of selling foodstuff. She continues with her business of selling foodstuff. Currently, she is the representative of this group. She is standing on the left in the photo. "A way to improve my income is to increase my stock," she comments. The advantage of her business is that the items are fast consumables; the disadvantage is that she lacks the funds to buy more foodstuff to sell to her customers.

Her dream is to open a big foodstuff joint and expand it. She would like to buy more foodstuff to sell to her customers.

This is the tenth loan that she has taken from the institution in five years.

She is married with one school-going child. She is working hard because of this child, so that she can take good care of him.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff  (yams, garden eggs, cooking oil and canned tomatoes) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Restita

texts.en:
This is Restita, who is 54 years old. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store in Toril, Davao City. She's been running her store for 10 years. She has already experienced different circumstances that really challenged her faith. There were times when her capital was almost drained due to the large sums of money owed to her. Some of her neighbors pay weeks or months later for the goods they get from her store. But Restita remains strong, because this is her way of assisting her fisherman husband, Rafael, in providing for their children’s needs. Their children are still studying in college.

A sari-sari store is comparable to a convenience store, but it’s smaller and has limited products. Examples of these products are sachets of toiletries, snack items, canned goods, instant foods, candies, beverages and other commodities. It’s quite advantageous for the people in the community to have an accessible variety store to buy one candy, an egg, and so on. This is the reason why sari-sari stores proliferate in the communities of the Philippines. This is also the reason why the competition becomes stiffer and stiffer. Customers prefer to buy from stores with wide selection and inventory. Restita worries about this because she can offer only limited stock. She appeals for your help through a loan of 40,000 PHP, which she can use to buy more supplies to improve her store. She aspires to grow her sales to be able to earn more.

Restita dreams that in the near future her business will progress and she can be a rice wholesaler. She wants her children to finish college and obtain good, stable jobs. She’s praying for long life as well as mental and spiritual well-being for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to improve her store.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 23 años al cultivo de caña de azucar y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, fertelizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Cruz is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He devoted 23 years to the cultivation of sugar cane. He sells the products in the surrounding towns. The earnings allow him to cover some household expenses.

Cruz requests a loan to buy fertilizer, pest control etc. This will allow him to continue with his work for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control etc.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, tiene tres hijos, pero solo dos están estudiando y todos viven con ella.

María, tiene un negocio de venta de sorbetes desde hace 8 años y este negocio lo aprendió con unos amigos, no tiene otras actividades económicas y antes era empleada en una tienda, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y su horario es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m.
                                                                               
María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más sorbetes para y poder dar más empleo a más personas.

Sueña con que su negocio sea más grande y también sueña con colocar otra tienda en otro lugar; además desea que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She has a high-school education and is married with three children. Only two are in school, and they all live with her.

María has had a business selling ice cream for the last 8 years. She learned the business from some friends. She does not have any other economic activities. She used to work in a shop. Her husband helps her with the business, and she works from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

María needs the loan to buy more ice cream, and to be able to employ more people. She dreams of having her business grow, and she also dreams of opening another store in another location. She also hopes that her children will complete their educations.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream.

loans.name: Lidia Amelia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de cincuenta y tres años de edad, que ha logrado ser un pilar para su familia, impulsada por su esposo ella monto su propio negocio de venta de granos básicos. Poco a poco ha logrado crecer como comerciante, por lo cual está profundamente agradecida. 
En esta temporada, ella tiene que dar un gran paso, como es comprar a grande cantidades arroz, frijoles, y otros granos básicos, dado que en los próximos meses iniciara el verano en Nicaragua y el precio de estos aumentara al igual que la demanda, por lo tanto ella ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permite invertir en estos granos. Con las ganancias planea mejorar la infraestructura de su local y comprar nuevos productos que aún no oferta.
texts.en:
Lidia is fifty-three years old and a pillar for her family. Her husband encouraged her to set up her own business of selling basic grains. Gradually she grew as a trader. She is deeply grateful.

This season, she has to take a big step such as buying large quantities of rice, beans, and other basic grains. In the coming months, summer will begin in Nicaragua and the price will increase with demand.

She is reaching out to Kiva with MiCrédito for a loan that allows her to invest in these grains. With the profits, she plans to improve local infrastructure and buy new products that are not being offered yet.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of rice, beans, and other basic grains

loans.name: Grupo San Francisco Solo Group

texts.es:
Un pequeño pueblo del Estado de México se encuentra protegido entre los extensos cerros repletos de árboles frondosos que llenan de aire puro la región. No obstante la escases de transporte público hace difícil el acceso a quienes no tengan vehículo, son muchas las personas que deben caminar varios kilómetros para llegar a sus hogares. Aun con todo,  los habitantes mantienen siempre un carácter festivo y ya están esperando la celebración más grande en el 2 de noviembre, día de los fieles difuntos, donde se acostumbra visitar a sus difuntos en sus respectivos panteones.
   Don Porfirio es un hombre trabajador y muy entregado a su familia integrada por su pareja Olivia y sus cuatro hijos los cuales estudian actualmente. La cría de ganado bovino ha sido el negocio que desde  su juventud lo ha mantenido activo. Él recuerda que en su niñez no había escuelas por lo que, al vivir en el campo, sintió un enorme gusto al saber que cuidaría de animales. En un inicio sus padres le ayudaron a adquirir los primeros ejemplares y posteriormente, con sus ganancias, compró más. “Mi primer animal fue una pequeña oveja que creció muy bien, después eso me motivó a tener muchas más” comentó con alegría. Durante 8 o 6 meses está atento al proceso con el cual alcanzan el peso y estatura ideal para poder ser vendidos a buen precio.
   Durante muchos años dicha actividad ha sido el sustento de su familia y la base de sus metas. Por otro lado, ha sido beneficiado con préstamos de VF México los cuales han sido de ayuda para comprar alimento necesario en el desarrollo de su ganado; con el nuevo apoyo planea comprar más ejemplares. Uno de sus sueños es lograr que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional, además de mejorar su calidad de vida, y, desde luego, tener más corrales en donde continuar con su negocio. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Julia quien invertirá en reses; Luis, en cerdos; Juan, en pollos y Ana Laura, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal.
texts.en:
A small town in Mexico is protected by the extensive hills full of lush trees that fill the region with clean air. Shortage of public transportation makes it difficult for those without vehicle to access. There are many people who have to walk several kilometers to reach their homes. Despite that, people always maintain a festive attitude and are now waiting for the biggest celebration on November 2. It is All Souls Day, when people visit the deceased in their cemeteries.

Porfirio is hardworking and very committed to his wife Olivia and his four children who are currently students. Cattle breeding have been his work since his youth. He recalls that there were no schools in his childhood. While living in the country side, he felt a great pleasure learning to take care of the animals. At first his parents helped him buy the first livestock. Later, he bought more with his earnings. "My first animal was a small sheep that grew very well. Later, that motivated me to have many more." he said happily. It takes 8 or 6 months of process to reach the ideal weight so that they can be sold at a good price.

For many years, his work has supported his family and his goals. But at the same time, he benefited from Mexico VF loans which helped to buy cattle feed for the development of his livestock. He requests a new loan to buy more livestock. One of his dreams is to have his children obtain professional degrees and improve their quality of life. Also, he wants to have more ranch to continue his work.

The other group members are Julia who invested in cattle; Luis, in pigs; Juan in chickens, and Ana Laura in sheep.

* The photograph was taken on the steps of city kiosk.

loans.use: to buy feed for their calves.

location.town: San Francisco Solo, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Kuriyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Kuriyah, who is 47 years old and married with four sons and one daughter. Kuriyah is a housewife and her husband has been a merchant for the past 8 years. She has requested a loan of 7,200,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and access water sources, but Kuriyah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home that will provide access to clean water for her family.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris has always been passionate about providing computer services. He enjoys helping people and specializing in providing remote support. He has been working on the incarnation of GeeksOnTime for the past year. GeeksOnTime is a business that provides in-home computer repair services. When the business experienced a downfall in 2008, he partnered up with the sole proprietor to work on starting up the business again.

The greatest success he has had thus far has been the opportunity to grow the company and help it succeed. He is currently seeking a loan that will help him with the costs of redesigning his website. He would also like to purchase technical services he could resell in his business. His vision for the future is to scale his business to a point where he can hire additional employees.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of redesigning his website and purchasing technical services that can be resold throgh his business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is originally from the Dominican Republic. She loves to bake and decorate cakes and has owned her business for the past five years. Josefina has more than 30 years in the pastry industry and has received her pastry chef diploma from the Notter School of Pastry Arts.

The greatest success Josefina has had has been the opportunity to improve her cake decorating skills. She has met many people from different countries who have helped her further her knowledge as a chef. Furthermore, Josefina has had the privilege to work with well-known chefs who have been featured on daytime television shows.

Josefina is currently seeking a loan that will allow her to buy additional equipment that will help increase productivity. Her vision for the future is to continue seeking out new business opportunities. Josefina hopes to someday franchise her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment that will help increase productivity.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a very energetic and creative person. He is originally from the Dominican Republic and is the owner of Capture Moments. His business is devoted to providing high quality and artistic photography of special events and people.

Jorge has been in the United States for 17 years and depends on his income to support his two sons. His largest success has been the opportunity to meet and work with well-known artists in the music industry.

He is currently seeking a loan to improve his services through investing in additional photography equipment. His vision for the future is to continue growing his business and clientele.

loans.use: to purchase additional photography equipment

loans.name: Marybel

texts.en:
Marybel is a married woman. She is 36 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marybel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marybel requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishnet, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Marybel has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishnet, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 65 years old and married with eight children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en: Nixon lives in Liquisa and his business is printing machine rental. He lives near many people, so he had one idea to open a rental for everybody so if they want to print some clothes it should not be far away. He opened his business a few years ago, but he earns a good income every day because many people come to print clothes in his rental shop so he is very happy with his business. Now he is applying for a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve his business because he wants to open a bigger rental shop in the future. He started to open his rental shop in 2014 with his own working capital of $1000. He is taking this loan because he wants to use it to buy shirts, ink, turtleneck shirts, printing machines and other materials to use. He hopes with this loan, his business can be improved in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, ink, turtleneck shirts, printing machines and other materials to use.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Sharon is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy assorted vegetables like beans, squash, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables to sell in her local market.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables like beans, squash, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Lorena Gloribel

texts.es: Lorena de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Lorena is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. She has made a living selling clothes for a number of years now and began with her own capital. She meets her household expenses with what she obtains from her sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes wholesale to continue selling and to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Anahis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; la socia Anahis alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de autopartes de autos como parabrisas, faros entre otros, para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
Anahis belongs to the communal bank 'Padre Urraca'. She combines her daily activities with the sale of spare parts for vehicles such as windshield wipers, headlights and anything else that her customers require.

She has been in this business for a while and is successful thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She would like to continue with her business so she can support her family.

She is grateful for the loan opportunities and she promises to pay off the instalments in the agreed time. She will use the loan to buy windshield wipers amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy windshield wipers among other things.

loans.name: Natalia Elizabeth
