texts.es: Natalia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y perfumes el cual inicio con capital propio desde hace 15 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Natalia, 31, lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

She makes a living selling shoes and perfume. She started this business with her own money 15 years ago. She runs the business from home and has a lot of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods wholesale so she generate more income.

loans.use: to buy shoes and perfume wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Edenilson

texts.es:
José, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, creció con su familia que trabaja arduamente en los trabajos del campo y por sus escasos recursos económicos no se le dio la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios, actualmente vive con su abuela.

José, se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, trabajo que desempeña con su padre, también se dedica al trabajo como agricultor y trabajando en el cuido y mantenimiento de la finca para la producción del café, actualmente tiene una plantación de café en el patio de su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, fertilizantes para el cultivo de café.

Su sueño es poder construir su propia casa de bloque y continuar sus estudios que le permitan obtener un mejor empleo.
texts.en:
Jose, 21, studied until ninth grade. Due to a lack of money, he was unable to carry on studying. He grew up in a family which is used to working hard in the fields and he currently lives with his grandmother.

He works as a builder's assistant to his father as well as looking after a plot of land used for growing coffee.

At the moment, he has his own coffee crops on the patio of his home. He needs this loan to buy compost and fertilizers for these crops.

In the future, he dreams of building his own house and continuing with his studies, which will lead to a better job.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Dayelee Zoreyda

texts.es:
Dyalee es una joven que se vio interesada en la económica, la política y lo social, no solo de un país, sino de varias culturas, que le permitan aprender de estas y aplicarlas en su país. Lo que le facilitó en elegir en un segundo la carrera de Diplomacia y Relaciones Internacionales. Ahora, a sus 21 años de edad, cursa el cuarto año de la licenciatura todos los sábados, llegando ya a la etapa culminante de esta meta tan importante para ella. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá, de su padre, quien recibe una indemnización por invalidez, de su tía, quien trabaja en un hotel en el extranjero, para pagar la universidad.
Por otro lado, Dayalee también tiene el apoyo de su hermano, quien trabaja en un call center. Todo esto la hace sentirse respaldada y motivada por convertirse en una de las mejores profesionales, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar el curso de titulación y así poder culminar esta etapa importante de su vida y entrar al campo laboral sin problemas. En sus planes está obtener su propia casa, su carro, buscar un buen empleo, con el cual pueda apoyar a su familia y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Dyalee is a young student who became very interested in the economics, politics and social situation of different countries. She then applied what she learnt from the diverse cultures to her own country. All this lead to her opting to study a second degree in International Diplomatic Relations.

Now, at 21, she is in her fourth year and studies every Saturday. She is reaching the end of her studies, which means that an important goal is within reach.

She can count on the support of all her family. Her parents can help as her father receives benefits for disability. Her aunt, who works in a hotel abroad, can also contribute; as can her brother who works in a call centre.

Given the backing her family give her, she feels motivated to become a top professional. For this reason she is asking for a loan to pay the rest of her course fees and get the qualification which shows she has achieved one of her ultimate goals, making it easier for her to find work.

In the future she would like by her own house and find a good job, which will help her to support her family and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her course fees and get qualifications.

loans.name: Kenia Gissell

texts.es:
El amor por la justicia, llevaron a Kenia a estudiar la licenciatura en Derecho. A sus 36 años de edad es madre de una adolescente de catorce años, esposa, asistente legal desde hace cinco años y estudiante de esta carrera que tanto le apasiona. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, quien es cafetalero, y de su familia, lo que la ha motivado salir adelante sin ningún problema.
Kenia no solo es estudiante y trabaja para alguien, es visionera en los negocios, pues alquila cuartos a estudiantes universitarios para tener otros ingresos en su hogar. Actualmente está en quinto año de la carrera y no quiere tener ningún obstáculo más para terminar sus estudios. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar sus últimos meses de aranceles en la universidad y un posgrado que le traerá mejores oportunidades profesionales. En sus planes está abrir una oficina e independizarse con un despacho jurídico.
texts.en:
A passion for justice led to Kenia studying a degree in law. At 36, she is married and has a 14-year-old daughter. She has been a legal assistant five-years, during which time she has been studying on this course.

She has the support of her father who grows coffee; and the rest of her family who have given her the motivation to move get along.

She does not only study and work; she is a business minded person, too. She rents out rooms to students at university, which gives her extra income to support her household.

Currently, she is in the fifth year of her course and she does not want anything to stop her finishing her studies. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to pay for the last few months of university fees and the postgraduate certificate which will give her better job prospects.

In the future she plans to open her own office and become an independent law adviser.

loans.use: to pay for the last few months of university fees and her postgraduate certificate.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is from Jagna, Bohol. She is 38 years old and runs a small business growing onions, eggplants and rice.

Elisa has requested a loan from CEVI to expand her business. She would like to buy Ramgo brand seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. This will help Elisa to grow and sell more vegetables in the future.

Elisa and her husband have six children ages 2 to 12, five of whom are currently attending school.

loans.use: to buy Ramgo brand seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking woman who earns a living through raising and selling hogs. She is 26-year-old married woman with two children, ages 4 and 6 years old. Her husband has an income that can help defray the family's daily expenses.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy in pig feed and pigs, and she hopes this will help improve her financial income.

Irene has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a widowed woman, 67 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sonia has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like thread, cloth, needles, and maintenance for her sewing machine.

Sonia has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like thread, cloth, needles, and maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Yemma

texts.en:
Yemma is 37 years old, married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.

Yemma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Yemma has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Friends - N17Tthanhqnham Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt is 41 years old and married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Nguyệt lives in Quang Xuong district of Thanh Hoa, a rural town. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in the region. This area often suffers from natural disasters because it is near the sea, so her income is unstable.

The main hardship that Nguyệt faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2014, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has increased significantly. She is the group leader of "Friends - N17TThanhQNham", which consists of seven members.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nadiezka  Maria

texts.es:
Una sonrisa llena de humildad es la que irradia Nadiezka, una estudiante del quinto año de la carrera de Derecho. A sus 22 años de edad se siente orgullosa de estar a punto de finalizar esta carrera donde puede aplicar la justicia y defender a las personas que necesiten. En un principio su madre fue quien la impulsó a estudiar esta carrera, sin embargo ahora que está a punto de terminar siente la pasión por poner en práctica lo aprendido. 
Nadiezka cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien es secretaria de los bomberos de la capital y ha sido su pilar en las clases. La futura defensora de las leyes y de las personas solicita un préstamo para pagar los últimos aranceles de la universidad y para pagar su título, lo que le permitirá sellar con honores esta etapa importante de su vida y ejercer sus conocimientos. En sus planes está conseguir un empleo y seguir ampliando sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
A smile full of humanity is what irradiates Nadiezka, a fifth year law student. At 22 years old, she is proud of being about to finish her degree, with which she can apply justice and defend people who need it. At the beginning, it was her mother who drove her to study this subject. Nonetheless, now that she is about to finish, she feels passionate about putting what she has learned into practice.

Nadiezka has the support of her mother, who is the secretary for the capital firefighters and who has been her cornerstone during her classes. This future defender of the law and of people is asking for a loan to pay for the last university fees and for her degree. This will allow her to finish this important stage in her life with honors and put her knowledge into practice. Among her plans is getting a job and to continue expanding her knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her latest university fees and for her degree.

loans.name: Rogelio De Jesus

texts.es: Rogelio de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo del maíz, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Rogelio is 37 years old. He lives in his own home with his family group. For 10 years, he has been raising cattle and growing corn. Thanks to his work, he has been able to pay for the household necessities. He is asking for a loan again to buy more cattle to continue raising cattle and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Yesika Marilu

texts.es: Yesika de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y venta de pollos y tambien a la venta de tamales, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Yesika is 38 years old. She lives in her own home with her family group. For several years, she has raised and sold chickens. She also sells tamales. Her business is located at her residence and she has a lot of customers. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens so she can continue with her work and thus be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 27 años de edad tiene dos hijos menores en edad escolar. vive con su esposo, sus hijos y suegros, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace dos años, le va muy bien gracias al carisma y atención que les da a sus clientas que siempre regresan por la asesoría y los productos de buena calidad que ofrece. el préstamo que solicito lo invirtió en la compra de productos como cremas, joyas, perfumes y mas. el sueño que tiene es seguir creciendo día a día y poder comprar un stand para poder exhibir sus productos. Agradece a los inversionistas kiva por el apoyo brindado y pide que sigan apoyando  a gente que desea salir adelante.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 27 years old. She has two school aged children. She lives with her husband, her children and her parents in law. She has sold beauty products by catalog for two years. It is going very well for her thanks to her charisma and the service she gives her customers, who always return for her consults and for the good quality products that she offers. The loan she has asked for will be invested in buying products such as creams, jewelry, perfumes and more. Her dream is to keep growing day to day and be able to buy a booth to exhibit her products. She thanks the Kiva investors for their support and she asks for them to keep supporting people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as creams, perfumes, jewelry and more.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven apasionado con el mundo de las maquinas, le gusta saber cómo se hace para que cada aparato funcione de manera inteligente es por esta razón que estudia ingeniería industrial. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus abuelos y su mama de crianza, ellos se sienten muy orgullosos de Luis porque es un muchacho que tiene muchas metas y desea salir adelante. 
Para seguir estudiando y aprendiendo más cosas referentes a su carrera Luis solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora y suplir algunos gastos de la carrera una vez terminado sus estudios desea trabajar en una planta procesadora en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man who is passionate about the world of machines. He likes to know how to make each item work intelligently and for this reason he is studying industrial engineering. He has the support of his grandparents and his mother who raised him, they are very proud of Luis because he is a young man who has many goals and a desire to get ahead.

To continue studying and learning more things about his career, Luis asks for a loan to purchase a computer and pay some of the expenses for his program. Once he finishes his education he wants to work in a processing plant in his city.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and pay some of the expenses for his program.

loans.name: Edwin Miguel

texts.es:
Edwin, de 24 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio técnico en agronomía, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al comercio, ella elabora productos como pasteles y otro tipo de comida típica, tiene un 1niño de 18 meses de nacido y en su casa viven sus tres hijastras, que le ayudan en la venta de su casa.

Edwin, actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace más de 2 años, anteriormente trabajo para una institución pero perdió el empleo y se ha dedicado a la agricultura.-

Edwin, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos chivos, para engordarlos y criarlos para venderlos y seguir trabajando con ganado, pero también necesita una pequeña parte para comprar insumos agrícolas.
 
Edwin, sueña con trabajar fuertemente la agricultura y comprar y vender ganado para poder generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old. He is a farmer and went to school for a technical degree in agronomy. He is married and his spouse works as a merchant. She makes products such as pastries and other types of traditional food. He has an 18 month old child and three stepdaughters who live in his home who help with the sales from the home.

Edwin has bought and sold livestock for more than 2 years. Previously, he worked for an institution, but he lost his job and now he works in agriculture.

Edwin needs the loan to buy two goats to fatten them up and raise them to sell and continue working with livestock. He also needs a small part of it to buy agricultural supplies.

Edwin's dream is to work hard at agriculture and buy and sell livestock to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy two goats.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.es:
Mamerto, es un hombre comprometido con su trabajo y con su familia, con la ayuda de sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, saca adelante sus cosechas de maíz y frijol. Cree que fielmente que una forma de fortalecer su negocio es por los financiamientos, está realmente agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito porque ambas organizaciones han depositado confianza en él.  
Este hombre trabajador, solicita un préstamo, para ocuparlo en la compra de abono, refrescante de tierra, pesticidas y una vitamina especial para las matas de frijol. En un futuro desea invertir en la comprar de más terreno para cosechar y poder vender su producto a los mercados de las principales ciudades del país.
texts.en:
Mamerto is a man who is committed to his work and his family. With the help of his four children and his wife, he gets his corn and bean crops ahead. He believes faithfully that a way to strengthen his business is through loans. He is very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because both organizations have put their trust in him.

This hard-working man asks for a loan to use it to purchase manure, fertilizer, pesticides and a special vitamin to clear out the beans. In the future, he wants to invest in the purchase of more land to harvest and be ale to sell his product in the markets in the principal cities of the country.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and a special vitamin.

loans.name: Yuri Audelia

texts.es:
Yuri, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente trabaja como empleada en una tienda donde se venden productos de primera necesidad, está soltera, vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanos.

Yuri, tiene más de 10 años de laborar como empleada en la misma tienda, trabaja todos los días con horarios extendidos, recorre una distancia de 2 kilómetros diarios desde su casa, hasta el lugar de trabajo.

Yuri, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicina para su mamá, porque está enferma y no tiene dinero para poder comprarle la medicina. 

Su sueño es poder continuar sus estudios, para tener mejores oportunidades de empleo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su madre y de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Yuri, 25 years old, went to school through secondary school. Currently she works as an employee in a store where they sell basic products. She is single and lives with her mother and two siblings.

Yuri has been working as an employee in the same store for over 10 years. She works every day with long hours, and goes a distance of 2 kilometers daily from her house to the work site.

Yuri needs the loan to purchase medicines for her mother because she is sick and she doesn't have money to be able to purchase the medicine for her.

Her dream is to be able to continue with her education to have better job opportunities and improve the living conditions for her her mother and her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her mother.

loans.name: Kelly Yuriko

texts.es: Kelly es una joven  de 18 años de edad que estudia la carrera de educación inicial desde hace un año y nueve meses aproximadamente, siempre le ha gustado los niños y siente que es su vocacion enseñar a los mas pequeños, Ella vive al lado de su madre a quien ayuda en sus ratos libres,su familia es de bajos recursos economicos por el cual no cuentan con el dinero para poder ayudar a su hija en los estudios y ella tiene que buscar como solventar sus gastos,el dinero que solicitó lo invertira en las mensualidades de la universidad y en la compra de materiales que le piden para hacer trabajo de manualidades. Kelly se siente feliz de recibir el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva ya que le ayuda a progresar y a lograr el sueño que tanto anhela.Kelly dice " les agradezco de corazón la oportunidad de ayudarme por que se que con su ayuda saldré adelante.
texts.en: Kelly is a young woman, 18 years old, who has been studying for a degree in early childhood education for approximately a year and nine months. She has always liked children and feels that her vocation is to teach the littlest ones. She lives with her mother who she helps in her free time. Her family has limited economic resources so they don't have the money to be able to help their daughter in her education and she has to look for a way to cover her expenses. The money that she asked for she will invest in the monthly fees for the university and in purchasing the materials that she needs to do the hands-on work. Kelly is happy to get the support of the Kiva investors since it helps her to progress and achieve the dream that she wants so much. Kelly says, "I thank you from my heart for the opportunity to help me because I know that with your help I will get ahead."

loans.use: to pay the monthly fees and materials that are required of her at the university.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Рачаб молодой активный бизнесмен. Он имеет свой частный бизнес. Рачаб живет в районе Яван. Он с детства мечтал идти по стопам отца. Сейчас уже 7 лет Рачаб занимается животноводством. Он хорошо справляется бизнесом. Рачаб покупает скота и откармливает несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить животноводческой деятельности. Его доходы только от этой деятельности. Рачаб старается ради семьи, чтобы кормить и одевать. У него есть маленький ребенок. Он живет вместе родителем на районе. Рачаб с большими надеждами обратился за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать его сейчас.
texts.en: Rajab is a young and active businessman. He has his own private business. Rajab lives in the Yavan region. He has dreamed of following in his father's footsteps since childhood. Now Rahab has been rearing animals for seven years. He manages his business well. Rajab buys cattle and fattens them up for a few months, then resells them at the cattle market. He wants to increase the size of his herd and expand his animal rearing business. His only income is from this business. Rajab strives for the sake of his family, in order to feed and clothe them. He has a small child. He lives with his parents in the area. Rajab has applied for a loan with high hopes. You can support him now.

loans.use: to buy some cattle and expand his animal rearing business.

loans.name: Nini Johana

texts.es: Nini es una emprendedora mujer que decidió dejar su empleo para estar más cerca de su familia, ella es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad y no cuenta con el apoyo del cónyuge porque se encuentra separada; el sustento de su familia depende exclusivamente de ella.  Con la liquidación que recibió de su anterior empleo instaló una tienda de víveres y abarrotes en la que diariamente atiende a sus clientes a partir de las 7 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 9 p.m. ella maneja un amplio surtido de los productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar entre ellos lácteos, enlatados, carnes, verduras, legumbres, golosinas y bebidas y en la actualidad necesita renovar el surtido y variedad de productos es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en víveres; aceite, arroz, enlatados y demás.  Su meta es poder ampliar su tienda y ser reconocida en el sector.
texts.en: Nini is an enterprising woman who decided to leave her job to be closer to her family. She is the mother of two children, ages 6 and 4, and doesn't have the support of a spouse because she is separated. The sustenance of her family depends exclusively on her. With the settlement she got from her previous job, she set up a grocery store where she serves her customers daily from 7:00 am continuously to 9:00 pm. She manages a wide assortment of products that make up the family pantry, among them dairy products, canned goods, meats, vegetables, legumes, candies and drinks and currently she needs to renew the assortment and variety of products and for this she is applying for her first Kiva loan, which she is doing now with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in groceries: oil, rice, canned goods, and more. Her goal is to be able to expand her store and be known in the sector.

loans.use: to invest in groceries: oil, rice, canned goods and more.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel, 31, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leizel has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Leizel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 38 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school.

Emelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients. Yulia is a 32-year-old married woman with four sons and one daughter. Yulia is a housewife and her husband has had a small store that sells hand phones and accessories for 16 years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet and water sources at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Yulia will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet and access to water at their home.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and fish vending.

Dina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like chips, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Dina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like chips, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lore

texts.en:
Lore is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her pig fattening.

Lore is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seeds and pay for laborer salaries for land preparation.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lore dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seeds and pay for laborer salaries for land preparation.

loans.name: Engels Augusto

texts.es: El amor por las plantas y los animales es lo que llevo a Engels a estudiar Ingeniería Agropecuaria su principal apoyo son sus padres que trabajan en una clínica. Poco a poco se ha ido desempeñando en su carrera pero para ser más eficiente Engels solicita un crédito para comprar instrumentos veterinarios tales como bisturí, de esta manera podrá atender todos los campos pecuarios en su ciudad. Dentro de sus metas próximas desea tener veterinarias en toda Nicaragua y ser competente en el mercado.
texts.en:
A love of plants and animals led Engels to study agricultural engineering. His parents, who work in a clinic, are his main support.

Engels has been working at his program little by little, but to be more efficient he's requesting a loan to buy veterinary instruments such as a scalpel. That way he'll be able to tend to all the cattle fields in his city.

Among his goals for the future, he wants to have veterinarians throughout Nicaragua and be successful in the market.

loans.use: to buy veterinary instruments such as a scalpel

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Meet Sally. Help her now grow her business by lending her additional financial assistance that she needs.

She is operating a sari-sari store business and it would be better if you let her avail a loan worth PHP 50,000. She will use this to buy more merchandise to sell.

There is nothing more she dreams but to help her family and grandchildren. For this reason, she has run her business to earn and save money. She's diligent and very passionate about handling her trade.

In advance, she would like to thank you for your generosity and heartfelt concern for people like her.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elsa Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y ella le ayuda, tienen dos niños pequeños. 

Maribel, se dedica a la pesca artesanal como la mayoría de personas de esa comunidad, aunque también es agricultora, puesto que junto a su esposo trabajan para sostener a sus dos hijos. 

Maribel, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para el cuido de frijol. 

Maribel, sueña con tener una casa en mejores condiciones para darles mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 39, is a very hardworking woman. She's in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture and she helps him. They have two small children.

Maribel earns a living in traditional fishing, like most people in her community. She's also a farmer, because she and her husband work to support their two children.

Maribel needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to tend to her beans.

Maribel dreams of having a house in better condition so she can provide better security for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her beans

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es:
José, de 32 años de edad, no estudio, porque eran de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y vende pasteles y yuca frita en su casa, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian. 

José, se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y también a la compra de cerdos, estos negocios los realiza desde hace más de 7 años, en estas actividades se involucra su pareja.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería para el negocio y para comprar insumos agrícolas.

Su sueño es tener un negocio bien posicionado y darle el apoyo económico que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and never went to school because of his family's limited economic resources. He lives with his partner, who is in charge of the household chores. She also sells pastries and fried cassava from their home. They have three children, of which two are going to school.

José has been working in agriculture and also in the business of raising pigs for more than seven years. His partner helps him with these activities.

José needs this loan to buy merchandise for his business and to buy agricultural supplies. His dream is to have a well-established business and to provide the support that his family needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business and to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rovelin

texts.en:
Rovelin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Rovelin earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rovelin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Yolanda Amparo

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años, de estado civil casada su esposo es taxista tienen dos hijos Milton de 22 todavía estudia  y Jordán de 7 años se encuentra en una escuela gratuita del sector,   se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, este negocio le deja tiempo libre para dedicarse a sus hijos, arreglar casas, ya que los ingresos de su esposo son escasos no cubren en su totalidad los gastos del hogar. Yolanda necesita el dinero para poder comprar  chanchos ganar dinero y poder alimentar, educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 40, is married and her husband's a taxi driver. They have two children: Milton, 22, is still in school, and Jordán, 7, attends a free school in the area.

She earns a living selling pigs. This business gives her free time to devote to her children and tidy up houses, because her husband's income doesn't cover all their household expenses.

Yolanda needs the money so she can buy pigs to earn an income and be able to feed and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalena is 42 years old and has one child still in school.

Magdalena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Magdalena has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 35 years old and has one child still in school.

Maribel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other materials for her business.

Maribel has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson, 27 and a resident of Taguig City, is a very diligent and hard-working father and husband. He is married to Estela and they are blessed with one young child.

Today, Jayson would like to take a loan that he will use in establishing and developing his current business, a small sari-sari(variety) store. He would just like to stock more grocery items to display and sell because it will improve his profits.

He would like to improve his sales so that, together with her wife, they can ably supply the basic need of their household. And, if there's an opportunity, they would like to save for their future, specially for their children's education.

He just needs PHP 50,000 for this business expansion and he is truly hopeful that you will be generous enough to help him with this.

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to stock more grocery items to display and sell.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce, aged 44, is from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Frederick and has only one child, who is an elementary student. They help each other make a living to prepare for their child's education since they believe that education is great equalizer among the rich and the poor.

To augment their income, Dulce started selling mineral water and electronic load credits to pre-paid mobile network subscribers a year ago and it has been doing quite well. She also started selling hamburgers to their community.

In view of this, she is hoping she could borrow funds in the amount of Php 15000 to pay for several gallons of mineral water, electronic load and buns, hamburgers to sell.

She is glad that there is CCT and KIVA who support and encourage small businessmen like her. She hopes to sustain and grown her businesses to be able to save for the college education of her child.

Dulce's dream, just like any loving mother, is to give her child the best education and a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gallons of mineral water to sell and for buns and hamburger for her burger stand, as well.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pig business.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years and she earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Gina has a pillow making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pillow making business, which she has been in for 16 years. Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her pillow making business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, en su casa solo vive ella, su abuela y un hermano.

Ramona, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura como jornalera, pero también tiene su propia tienda; se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace más de 4 años, este oficio se lo enseñaron su abuela y su hermana, también se dedica a la elaboración de petates y su abuela los comercializa.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para la tienda como arroz, frijoles, pan y café, porque invirtió para los gastos  agrícolas de su cultivo de maíz y esto le ocasiono que se quedara sin fondos para invertir en el negocio.

Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio y así brindar lo necesario para su familia, también sueña con poder comprar un vehículo para transportar mercadería para el negocio.
texts.en:
Ramona, 33, studied up to ninth grade. She's single and has a daughter, 5. She lives in her house with only her daughter, her grandmother, and a sibling.

Ramona earns a living as a day laborer in agriculture, but she also has had her own store for more than four years. Her grandmother and her sister taught her this business. She also makes petates [woven mats] and her grandmother sells them.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise for her store such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee, because she invested in agricultural expenses for her corn crop, which left no funds to invest in her business.

Ramona's dream is to strengthen her business so she can give her family what they need. She also dreams of being able to buy a vehicle to transport merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Remegia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Remegia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

Remegia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a married woman who lives in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines, together with her family. She is a mother of eight children that are already grown up.

Fortunata earns a living by selling fish. She sells fish from her husband’s catch. To be able to enhance their profit, she is thinking of buying more fish to sell. The problem is she doesn’t have enough money for capital; that is why she is asking for a loan.

She will buy additional fish to sell to increase her profit. She wants to increase her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a hardworking woman, an entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetable in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional seeds for her farm. She supplements this income with earnings from her raising pigs.

Ursula has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ursula dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeralyn is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Jeralyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jeralyn has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods, hotdogs, cooking oil, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Marivic successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods, hotdogs, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Everything she does is because of a dream-- to help her children finish their studies, own a house and make her business grow.

This is Teodora, 45, a resident of Taguig city. Married to Pepito, they both ensure the lives of their young three kids by supplying all their needs the best that they can. To help her husband, Teodora cooks and sells different food dishes and recipes. Her income or profit here is a very relevant aid in terms of their basic necessities at home.

To further improve the business, she wants to ask for a 35,000 PHP loan which she will use for buying more raw ingredients and food products for her food stall expansion. With this, she can surely gain more income/profit and part of what she will gain she will save for future investments.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness.

Teodora meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients and food products for her food stall expansion.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines.

Vilma is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She supplements this income with earnings from selling vegetables.

Vilma successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 62 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Merlinda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like nail polish, a nipper, a nail cutter and other materials for her business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail polish, a nipper, a nail cutter and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rowena has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like nail polish, a nipper, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like nail polish, a nipper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old and married with eight children; three children are currently in school. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Teresa has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Janel

texts.en:
Janel is a 37-year-old woman and lives in the municipality of Tubigon in Bohol Philippines. She has five children ages 16, 14, 13, 9 and 7 years old whom she wants to raise well. She wants to give them good education.

Janel has some financial problems, so she decided to start her own business to help her husband financially. Since she is good at cooking, she managed to start a food selling business. Her profits could help her pay for the school expenses of her children.

Thus, Janel is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as cream, flour, sugar and cooking oil.

She dreams of business improvement in the future to be able to have enough money to pay for an excellent education for her children. Additionally, she wishes for them to grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy cream, flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth is a married woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is 29 years old and a mother of two children ages three and four months old. To earn a living, she decided to raise and sell pigs. It is a business that she started out of financial necessity hoping it would provide a very good income.

She is now requesting a loan to buy cement because she needs to concrete the shed for her pigs. She will also buy piglets and feed for them.

Lilybeth wants to keep going until she reaches her goal of improving the conditions of her livelihood. She has a positive attitude and wants to become a successful individual someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and cement

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 39, has a live-in partner with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Trinidad has a food vending business in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Trinidad has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Trinidad would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 48 years old and single with four children, one of whom is still in school. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and has a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Elma has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old, married, and has five children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalinda has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Durante siete años Rosalina ha logrado mantener su pulpería a flote, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos después de que su esposo falleció.  Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio tanto en infraestructura como variedad de productos. Sus hijos ya están casados y ella vive sola, es por esta razón que desea seguir prosperando en su negocio y por ello solicita un crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, frutas y verduras. Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas podrá mejor su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalina has managed to keep her small grocery store open for seven years. Thanks to her efforts, she pulled through with her children following her husband's death. She has slowly improved the business infrastructure as well as the variety of products.

Her children are now married and she lives alone, this is why she wants to keep her business prosperous. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, fruits and vegetables. With the income earned, she will be able to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional baskets of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business. Annalyn has been in this business for 9 years. She earns more income from a food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Annalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Edwin Bladimir

texts.es: Edwin tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con su mamá y su hermana Siomara de 6 años ella estudia en una escuela estatal gratuita, su padre los abandono cuando era un niño,  inicio a criar chanchos desde los doce años cuando su abuela materna le regalo un cerdo pequeño, este negocio le proporciona tiempo para  trabajar  también como albañil ya que desde que su papa se fue él se responsabilizó  de las necesidades básicas de su madre y hermana. Edwin con este dinero compraría 10 chanchos, balanceado, medicinas después de cuidarlos un tiempo acrecentaría sus ganancias y podría seguir ayudando a pagar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and his 6 year old sister, Siomara. She studies at a free state-owned school. His father left them when he was a child.

He began raising pigs when he was 12 years old when his maternal grandmother gave him a little pig. This business leaves him with time to work as a bricklayer too. Since his father left he has been responsible for the basic necessities of his mother and sister.

Edwin will use the loan to buy ten pigs, feed, and medicines. After caring for them awhile his profits would increase and he could continue helping to pay the household expenses.

loans.use: to biy pigs, feed, and medicines

loans.name: Sheila Marie

texts.en:
Sheila Marie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sheila Marie is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sheila Marie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Sheila Marie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
A wonderful day, lenders!

This is Minerva.

Currently, she is managing her sari-sari store business at Taguig City. She has involved herself in this trade for six years now. Being a member of CCT, she was highly motivated to improve her business more through the word of God that they study every week. As of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household.

Sari-sari stores are often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite smaller than the usual and offers only limited products that are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, instant beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at a low cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers. At some point, customers can also have credit. But this sometimes becomes a difficulty for Minerva, especially when debts are not paid.

To improve her sales, Minerva would like to ask for help from you. She would like to borrow a loan worth PHP 50,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for her family’s daily living conditions. And, today, you can be a big part of her life.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store

loans.name: Josette

texts.en:
Josette is 25 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Josette is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josette has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jaemah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Jaemah, who is a 45-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Jaemah was selling clothing and electronic goods, and her husband is a builder.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Jaemah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet and water sources at her home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and new seeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling vegetables.

Luz dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and new seeds.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old and married with two children; both children are still in school. Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Lina has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa is a 45-year-old woman who owns a catering business with her mother and her best friend in Lusaka. All three are hard working and entrepreneurial with different talents.

Rupa is a former accountant, her friend has managed hotels, and her mother is a great cook. They decided to join together to be stronger. Rupa and her friend each have a daughter to support and provide for. They have been running their businesses from Rupa’s home and sell take-away Indian-specialty food.

Rupa is asking for a loan to purchase gasifying cookstoves and a stock of fuel pellets to improve the indoor air of their kitchen, spend less money on charcoal, and help save the forests of their country.

Her dream is to develop this business to help send both daughters to school, and one day, leave them a legacy, a business they can carry on.

loans.use: to pay for cookstoves and fuel pellets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo, de 35 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora que por la falta de recursos económicos no  se le fue posible estudiar, el trabaja como agricultor y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, está  casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y los otros ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar.  

Lorenzo, desde que estaba pequeño fue inculcado por su padre en los trabajos agrícola, como una manera de sobrevivencia para él y su familia. 

Lorenzo, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y para pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra donde cultivará.

Su sueño es aumentar su negocio, comercializar en grande y darle la oportunidad a su familia de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 35 years old, is a fighter. Due to the lack of financial resources he was not able to attend school. He works as a farmer and also raises pigs. He is married. His wife takes care of the home. He has four children. Two of them them study and two help with household chores.

Lorenzo was taught agricultural work at an early age by his father as a way to survive for himself and his family.

Lorenzo needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the rent on the land he will cultivate.

His dream is to increase his business, market on a larger scale, and to give his family the opportunity to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the rent on the land he will cultivate.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rufina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rufina has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Miscellany

texts.en:
Miscellany is a single woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Miscellany is 28 years old, and two of her children are presently in school.

Miscellany has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. Miscellany requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of assorted fruits to sell to her local market.

Miscellany has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of assorted fruits to sell to her local market

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf, age 32, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an photo studio shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase a new variety of camera for the photography. However, due to lack of money, her husband finds it difficult.

For that reason, his wife, Sadaf, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase a camera for the purpose of his photography business. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

Sadaf is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a camera for her husband's photography and increase his photo studio business.

loans.name: Jeusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jeusa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jeusa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Jeusa has been sustaining her business activities through a past loan from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Santos Mario

texts.es:
Santos, de 29 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, solamente logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, creció con su familia que trabaja arduamente en los trabajos del campo y por sus escasos recursos económicos no se le dio la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la elaboración de petates, tienen un hijo.

Santos, se dedica a trabajar como agricultor sembrando maíz, pero también se dedica a la elaboración de canastos, los cuales comercializa en la zona donde viven, ya que estos tienen demanda para la época de corta de café y de igual forma lo utilizan para el almacenamiento de cosas. 

El préstamo lo necesita para cultivar café y para comprar fertilizantes y abono para las plantas.

Su sueño es poder posicionarse en un mejor mercado, para poder comercializar sus canastos y de esta manera tener más ingresos que le permitan mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Santos is 29 years old. He is a hardworking person. He only managed to study until the ninth grade. He grew up working hard in the field with his family and because of limited financial resources was not given the opportunity to continue his studies. He is accompanied and his partner works making woven mats. They have a son.

Santos works as a farmer growing corn but also works making baskets which he sells in the area where they live. These are in demand for the coffee harvest season and can also be used for storing things.

He needs the loan to grow coffee and to buy fertilizer and compost for the plants.

His dream is to position himself in a better market to sell his baskets and thus to have higher earnings permitting him to improve his house.

loans.use: to cultivate coffee and to buy fertilizer and compost for the plants.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Doña Virginia es educadora pensionada, casada, tiene 65 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos, ambos mayores de edad e independientes económicamente. Vive con su esposo en una propiedad muy grande, que comparte con su madre y su hija, todos en casas separas pero en el mismo terreno. Doña Virginia desde antes de pensionarse ya se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, en especial ropa de niños y niñas, actividad que tomó con más fuerza luego de su jubilación y que le permite estar al cuido de su madre una adulta mayor y su hermano quien tiene una discapacidad visual. Conocedora de su negocio y experiencia de más de 19 años, se puede observar la buena utilización de los recursos financiados. Hasta el día de hoy ha demostrado ser trabajadora y muy responsable. Además su actividad productiva le permite mantenerse activa, distraerse, invertir su tiempo en algo que a ella le gusta como es el comercio, aunado a la oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales al hogar.  Toda la mercadería que vende la solicitante la compra en Nueva York, viaja de 2 a 3 veces al año a comprar la mercadería.  
Inicia con capital propio desde 1996, con los ahorros que tenía, gracias a su trabajo. Decide ir de viaje a Nueva York, logró comprar ropa y productos de belleza para sus compañeras de trabajo y su familia, todo lo logró vender. Le hicieron falta más pedidos, por lo que decidió volver a viajar y traer suficiente mercadería, de ahí en adelante esto le  permitió viajar tres veces al año por nueva mercadería y así mantiene su actividad por más de 19 años.
Sus principales clientes son colegas educadores, vecinos, conocidos, familiares y muchos otros de varias comunidades de Heredia. La mayoría de los clientes la visitan a su casa tanto para comprarle mercadería como para pagarle. Doña Virginia considera que vende ropa de calidad, marcas reconocidas y a muy buen precio, lo que le permite mantener un volumen de ventas estable durante todo el año, además de lograr la fidelidad de sus clientes, quiénes además siempre la recomiendan. La competencia para ella no representa una amenaza, por la línea de ropa que comercializa, ya que son muy pocas las personas que venden únicamente ropa para niños y niños, con facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia is a retired teacher and married. She is 65 years old, the mother of two children, who are both adults and financially independent. She lives with her husband in a very large property, which she shares with her mother and daughter - all in their separate houses but on the same grounds. Doña Virginia has been engaged in selling clothes, especially children's clothes, since before her retirement. She has taken up this business with more effort after her retirement, which allows her to care for her elderly mother and brother, who is visually impaired.

As she is very familiar with her business and has 19 years of experience, one can consider the good use of her financial resources. For all her life she has proven to be hardworking and very responsible. Additionally, her business allows her to stay active, mentally engaged, and to invest her time in something that she likes to do, such as commerce; which also gives her the opportunity to generate additional income for the household. All the merchandise she sells is bought in New York; she travels 2 to 3 times a year to buy the merchandise.

She started with her own capital in 1996, with the savings that she had thanks to her work. She decided to travel to New York, where she managed to buy clothes and cosmetics for her co-workers and family, and she managed to sell everything. They took more orders, and so she decided to travel again and bring sufficient merchandise, so that from then on, this has allowed her to travel three times a year for new goods and thus she has maintained this business for over 19 years.

Her main customers are her educator colleagues, neighbors, acquaintances, relatives and many others from various communities of Heredia. Most of her customers visit her home, as much as to buy merchandise there as to pay her, too. Doña Virginia considers that she sells quality clothing, with well-known brands, and at great prices; which allows her to maintain a stable sales volume throughout the year and to keep the loyalty of her customers, who are always recommending her. Competition does not represent a threat to her, due to the clothing lines that she markets, since very few people sell only children's clothing, and with payment plans.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: clothes for children from size 0 to 14.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Catherine has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Catherine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a hardworking female entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with her earnings from selling vegetables and a general store.

Cristy successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is from Stepanavan city of the Lori region. He works at the college and is a lecturer in his subject. History is his profession. Kamo is married and his wife also teaches. They have two children and both of them are students. Their son studies at the State University at the faculty of Law. His daughter studies at the same University but at the faculty of International Relations and Political Science.

Both of them are studying at the fee paying division of the University. Currently it is a great hardship for Kamo to solve this financial problem, since his children’s tuition fees are well in excess of the family’s monthly income. So Kamo is asking for this loan of 625.000 AMD as he must pay for his children’s tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Yandun Chitan

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 39 años de edad,  está casada su esposo se dedica a manejar un taxi tiene dos hijos Daniela de 18 y William de 12 estudian en Colegios Gratuitos. Hace seis años todos los días se levanta muy temprano a preparar de la mejor forma los alimentos  que va a vender en el bar estudiantil. Eugenia necesita el dinero para surtir su negocio así aumentaría sus ingresos para ayudar a satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar.
texts.en: Eugenia, 39, is maride and her husband drives a taxi. They have two children, Daniela, 18, and William, 12, who both go to free schools. For six years, they've woken up early to prepare the best foods for the student bar. Eugenia is requesting a loan to increase her income in order to cover off the basic household expenses.

loans.use: expand her business.

loans.name: Demetrio Nicolas

texts.es:
Demetrio Nicolás con 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Demetrio Nicolás cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Demetrio Nicolás se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Demetrio Nicolás es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Demetrio Nicolás, who is 47 and in a civil union, lives with his partner and children in his own house made of rustic materials. They live in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, in Cajamarca, Perú.
 
He is a farmer, growing coffee specifically with an experience of eight years. He has very good personal and work references from the local residents. 

The loan will be used for farming tasks, to add and apply pesticides and fertilizers, and to hire labor for the harvest. This will help him to realize physiological, morphological, and productive improvements in his crops, as well as to obtain a timely harvest. With a better  production and better product quality, he will have no problem selling his product. 

Demetrio Nicolás is a recurrent partner with the Edpyme Alternativa institution. He signs with his partner.

loans.use: to do farm work, adding and applying pesticides and fertilizers, and to hire labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Richard Denis

texts.es:
Richard Denis, con 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.
