Richard Denis cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Richard Denis se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, desde hace 8 años.Se solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos e invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca, de esta manera obtener mayores rendimientos.

Richard Denis es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Richard Denis, 25, has a civil union and lives with his partner and son in the Callacyuc district in the province of Jaén, in the department of Cajamarca, in Perú. Richard Denis has good personal and professional references from the people in the area. The inhabitants of this area work in agriculture, commerce and animal breeding.

Richard Denis is a farmer, specifically, he's been cultivating coffee for the last 8 years. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of his farm in order to generate more income.

Richard Denis is a member of the Edpyme Alternativa institution. He has had a loan previously and has paid it off on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marivic is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, coffee, meat, vegetables, etc., for her food production business.

Marivic has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, coffee, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jan

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Jan is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more shoes, bags, underwear, slippers, dresses, T-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers for her business.

Jan has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, bags, underwear, slippers, dresses, T-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es: Pedro habita en Suba una localidad ubicada al noroccidente de Bogotá en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, y gracias a su experiencia obtenida en una granja avícola conoció mucho sobre este negocio.  Con la ayuda de su cónyuge crearon rutas de comercialización dirigidas a negocios de comidas como asaderos y restaurantes, a quienes propusieron sus productos con gran éxito,  hoy en día su base de clientes es mucho más amplia y su ingreso más propicio para responder por los gastos en el hogar y ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos. En la actualidad su capital es insuficiente para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para incrementar su inventario de pollos. Pedro tiene una meta a futuro y es tener sus propios salones de cría y levante de pollos.  En lo personal desea tener casa propia para que sus hijos gocen de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Suba, an area located northwest of Bogotá where he lives with his wife and children. Thanks to the experience he obtained working in a poultry farm he knows a lot about this business.

He and his wife have created marketing routes aimed at food businesses such as grills and restaurants who have offered their products with great success. Today their customer base is much broader and their income more favorable for paying the household expenses and for the wellbeing of their children.

His capital is currently insufficient to meet the orders of his customers and this is why he is applying for his first Kiva loan currently being processed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to increase his inventory of chickens.

Pedro has a future goal of having his own coop for breeding and raising chickens. Personally he wants to have his own house for his children to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of chickens

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a responsible mother of 2 children and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family.

Now her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because currently it is not in good condition. It requires more maintenance which incur charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do this maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Asma's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily, and can then provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Asma also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income, in order to meet her family's future needs.

Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Loan Changes My Life - 30-02-01Pthắngđthọ Group

texts.en: Sâm is 42 years old, and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for eight years. Sâm lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household. The main hardship that Sâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sugar, candy, cakes, and other items to sell. Sâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has increased significantly. She is the group leader of Loan Changes My Life - 30-02-01 PThắngĐThọ, which consists of seven members. In the future, Sâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 67 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, es agricultor, actualmente está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales dependen económicamente de los ingresos de él; por razones económicas, no estudió, pero gracias a la oportunidad del programa de alfabetización aprendió a leer y a escribir.

Jesús, se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y tule, su trabajo ha sido un medio para sobrevivir en su familia, teniendo en cuenta que este medio le genera buenas ganancias, para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia. 

El crédito lo necesita para cultivar maíz y frijoles.

Su meta es construir su casa, aunque sea de adobe, porque necesita darle mayores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús, 67, is a hard-working man, he's a farmer, he's married and his partner is a housewife. He has 3 children who depend on him financially. For financial reasons, he didn't attend school, but thanks to the literacy program he learned to read and write.

Jesús cultivates corn, beans and tule. His work has been a way to survive in his family since his business generates good earnings and he is able to cover the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to cultivate corn and beans.

His goal is to build a house, even though it's of adobe, because he needs better accommodations for his family.

loans.use: cultivate corn and beans.

loans.name: Jennifer Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y superarse, 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltera  vive con sus padres y su hermano ella inicio hace 4 años criando pollos con sus pequeñas ganancias logro comprar una chancha que pario 10 cerdos pequeños los vendió con parte del dinero que obtuvo construyo una chanchera para poder cuidarlos mejor. Gabriela requiere el dinero para comprar chanchos, yerba, balanceado, al momento de la venta obtendría mayores ganancias ella aspira poder comprar un terreno.
texts.en: Gabriela really wants to work hard and be successful. She is twenty-one, single, and lives with her parents and her brother. Four years ago, she began raising chickens, and with her small income she managed to purchase a sow, which had a litter of ten piglets. She sold them, and with part of the money from the sales she built a pen to better care for them. Gabriela needs this loan to buy pigs, feed and medicines. Once she earns enough money she would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Radha

texts.en: Radha is 39 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the financial needs of the family. Radha is also providing sewing services to earn income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. She needs tailoring supplies such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these supplies and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Radha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
This is Rosanna, who is 43 years old and is from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bernard, who is a driver. They work as a team making a living and raising their two children, who are in high school and elementary. Since her husband's salary is not enough to fully cover the growing household expenses and the children's school needs, Rosanna decided to open a small internet shop in their community.

She has been operating her computer rental shop for two years already and is glad that it is doing quite well. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go to an internet shop either for their business and business documents, or for school requirements. She rents out computers by the hour and also offers printing and typing services.

To further improve her services, Rosanna would like to buy a new computer for her business, for which she will be needing funds to the amount of PHP 40,000. The income generated from her internet shop helps a lot with their daily household expenses and the school requirements of her children.

She thanks God and you in advance for your valuable help.

Rosanna aims to open another branch in a nearby town and to send her children to college, to allow them to become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional computer for her internet shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina, 60, is married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She also raises pigs for extra income. Angelina requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell. Angelina has borrowed and repaid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Demetria, de 58 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, tiene 1 hijo que ya está acompañado y ya no depende de ellos.

Demetria, desde pequeña creció trabajando en los cafetales, en el cultivo del maíz y de frijoles, estas actividades todavía las sigue realizando, pues en la zona donde vive no hay otra oportunidad de trabajo que generen ingresos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y para pagar mano de obra para sembrar, pues es de esas actividades que obtienen sus ingresos para sobrevivir.

Sus sueños y su meta principal es el mejoramiento de su vivienda, además de eso, desea seguir trabajando fuertemente en la agricultura y ahorrar un poco para su familia.
texts.en:
Demetria is 58 years old. She takes care of household chores. She studied until the third grade. She lives with her domestic partner and has one son who is now partnered and no longer depends on them.

Demetria, from childhood, grew up working in the coffee fields, and growing corn and beans. She continues doing these activities as in the area where she lives there are no other job opportunities to generate income.

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to sow. This is the work she does to obtain income in order to survive.

Her dream and main goal is to improve her housing. Besides that, she wants to continue working hard in agriculture and save a little for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to sow

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus seis menores hijos, en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia de Jaén, en el departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Máximo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Máximo se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café, desde hace más de 15 años. El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de abonos e inversión en el mantenimiento de su finca, de esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos. CULTIVO DE CAFÉ.

Máximo es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado varios créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Máximo, 46, lives in a common law marriage in the district of Callacyuc, in the province of Jaén in Catamarca, Peru with his wife and their six young children. Máximo has great personal and professional references from other residents of the region. The residents of this area tend to work in agriculture, business and livestock.

Máximo works in agriculture, specifically, growing coffee, which he has done for over 15 years. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers and to invest in maintaining his farm. This way, he will be able to generate greater earnings.

Máximo is an established member of the Edpyme Alternativa Institute. He has received various loans, all of which he has paid off on time.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and invest in maintaining his farm.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: A married woman, Phalla, is 41 years old and blessed with three dependent children. Residing in Kampong Cham province, she has been earning a living through growing cassava and rice. Earning around US$16 per day, she can save around US$11 per day. Low cassava is the main challenge to her farming business. This will be her second loan with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her buy enough household supplies and agriculture tools for the farming business. Phalla will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to support her cassava and rice field and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can improve her standard of living, support her family’s needs in a timely manner, and buy two hectares of arable land to grow cassava.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to support her cassava and rice field so that she can improve her standard of living and buy an additional plot of arable land to grow cassava

loans.name: Meaalofamariamatalena

texts.en:
Meaalofamariamatalena is a 49-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living.

Meaalofamariamatalena requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de um filho menor de idade, não responsabiliza-se por mais ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2015, este é o seu 2º empréstimo com qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, barrotes e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende concluir o seu estabelecimento comercial e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Gregorio was born in Namaacha Province of Maputo. He is 30 years old, lives with his common law wife and has one young child. He does not support anyone else.

He began working with Hluvuku in 2015. This is his second loan, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, beams and other items to continue construction on his residence.

In the future he plans to finish building a commercial establishment and to purchase a car. His greatest challenge is to finish construction.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and beams to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Fernando nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 35 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 vão a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu pai.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 4º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: cimento, varões, areia e pedrinhas, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência. 
O seu maior sonho é abrir um estaleiro para venda de material de construção e construir dependências para arendar. O mesmo tem como seu maior desafio garantir e melhorar o ensino dos seus filhos e concluir a sua residência para dar mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Fernando was born in Namaacha province of Maputo. He is 35 years old and lives with his common law wife. He has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school, and he also supports his father.

He began working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his 4th loan, which he plans to use to purchase construction material such as cement, metal bars, sand, and gravel in order to continue construction on his home.

His greatest dream is to open a shop to sell construction materials and to build outbuildings to rent. His greatest challenges are to pay for and improve his children's education, and to finish his home to provide more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, metal bars, sand and gravel to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Leydy Araceli

texts.es:
Leydi Araceli con 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos,en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Leydi Araceli cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Leydi Araceli se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, desde hace más de 03 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales menores y alimentos para estos. De esta manera le facilitará obtener un ingreso adicional por la venta de animales menores y mejorar su nivel de vida de su unidad familiar.

Leydi si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Leydi Araceli is 23 years old and lives in a common law marriage in the district of Laguna, Chiclayo in Lambayeque, Peru, with her husband and their children. Lloyd Araceli has many great personal and professional references from the residents of her region. The residents of this area tend to work in farming and livestock.

Leydi Araceli works raising dairy cows, which she has done for over three years. She is seeking a loan to purchase small animals and feed for them. This way, she will be able to generate an additional revenue stream by selling these small animals so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

Leydi has an established loan history although she is a new member of the Edpyme Alternativa Institution.

loans.use: purchase small animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Milagrose

texts.en:
Milagrose is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Milagrose dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetable in the Philippines. Elisa has been farming vegetable for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Elisa is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers, seedling and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers, seedlings and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are still in school. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods etc. Victoria has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods etc.

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
Durante nueve años Martha ha deleitado a sus clientes con sus deliciosos nacatamales y frijoles cocidos, su abuela es su principal apoyo en la realización de los nacatamales. Martha trabaja todos los días para mejorar la economía de su familia y ver crecer a sus hijos que aun están en edad escolar. 
Para seguir supliendo la demanda de sus clientes por los nacatamales y frijoles cocidos Martha solicita un crédito para comprar maíz, verduras, carne, frijoles entre otros. De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida con las ganancias obtenidas.
texts.en:
For nine years, Martha has delighted her customers with her delicious nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and beans. Her grandmother is her biggest supporter in making the nacatamales. Martha works everyday in order to improve her family's financial situation so that she can watch her school-aged children grow. 

In order to continue meeting her customers' demand for nacatamales and beans, Martha is seeking a loan to purchase corn, vegetables, meat, beans, etc.  This way, she will be able to improve her quality of life with her earnings.

loans.use: purchase corn, vegetables, meat, beans and other items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Betty works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Betty is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman with four children. She is 51 years old and two of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Fatima has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Fatima requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of assorted fruit to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of assorted fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: Yanira tiene 39 años de edad, una hija de seis años que está estudiando gratuitamente en una escuela del sector, es madre soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de víveres en su pequeña tienda todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las once de la noche hace seis años atrás cuando la falta de dinero para cubrir la alimentación de su pequeña la motivo a emprender este  negocio sin descuidar a su hija. Yanira con el dinero compraría más productos obtendría mayores ingresos para continuar pagando los gastos de alimentación, salud y educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Yanira is 39 years old, she has a six year old who attends the local school, is a single mother, and works selling groceries daily from 6am to 11pm in her small store. Six years ago when she no longer had enough money to feed her daughter, she decided to start this business so that she could take care of her daughter.

With this loan, Yanira will purchase more products so that she could generate greater earnings and continue to provide for her daughter's nutrition, health and education.

loans.use: purchase more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Artur

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo, tem 26 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 1 filho menor de idade e responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, contrair matrimónio e abrir um negócio da venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade.
texts.en:
Artur was born in Namaacha Province of Maputo. He is 26 years old and lives with his common law wife. He has one young child and also supports his mother.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku, which he will use to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, metal panels and more in order to continue construction on his home.

In the future he plans to complete construction on his home, get married, and open a shop selling basic staple items.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal panels and more to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sharon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Vicente Otoniel

texts.es:
Vicente, de 50 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos no le fue posible terminar sus estudios y solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y por el momento no tienen hijos.

Vicente, trabaja como albañil, pero ademas de eso se dedica también a la agricultura y a la elaboración de puertas de metal, siempre con el objetivo de suplir las necesidades de su familia.

Vicente, necesita el préstamo para comprar un aparato de soldadura y para comprar materiales para soldar.

Su sueño es tener la bendición de un hijo y terminar de construir su casa y seguir trabajando fuertemente.
texts.en:
Vicente, 50, wasn't able to complete his education because he lacked the financial resources, and he only studied up to third grade. He's married and his wife is a homemaker; they don't have any children at the moment.

Vicente works as a bricklayer but he also works in agriculture and making metal doors, always with the goal of fulfilling his family's needs.

Vicente needs the loan to buy welding equipment and welding supplies.

His dream is to be blessed with a child, to finish building his house, and to continue to work.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment and supplies

loans.name: Calina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 27 anos de idade, casada oficialmente mãe de 1 filho menor de idade que frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em Maputo.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 3º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e dar continuidade com os estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Calina was born in Maputo. She is 27 years old, legally married, and has one young son who attends school. She also supports her mother who lives in Maputo.

She began working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is her 3rd loan, which she will use to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, metal bars, and more in order to continue construction on her house.

In the future she plans to complete construction on her home and continue her studies through post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal bars, and other items to continue construction on her home.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years old and married with two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell such as milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ana Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable and fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ana Maria is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ana Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of their family. Chanda is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute, together with her husband, to manage the household.

She needs different sewing necessities, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these necessities. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above necessities and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Chanda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy various sewing necessities, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her sewing business so she can expand it.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 59-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children.

Parveen has been running a general store for the past five years. She wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for her business. But, due to financial constraints, she is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to buy all these commodities and earn maximum profitable income to manage her household and business.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her general store business.

loans.name: Chamangul

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Чамангул. Ей 50 лет. Она проживает вместе с семьей на районе Яван. У нее большая семья, состоящая из ее любимого мужа, двое сыновей, невестка, внуков и трое дочери. Невестка домохозяйка, она следит за порядком дома и за детьми. Младшие дочери учатся в средней школе. Сама Чамангул дома занимается выращиванием мелко рогатого скота. Она хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скота. Для совершения данной операции ей необходимо определенная сумма денег. Так как у нее нет денег, Чамангул обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: In the photograph is depicted Chamangul. She is 50 years old. She and her family live in the Yavan region. She has a large family comprising her beloved husband, two sons, her daughter-in-law, grandchildren, and three daughters. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker; she keeps order at home and looks after the children. Her younger daughters are studying in secondary school. Chamangul herself is engaged in rearing sheep and goats at home. She wants to expand her animal rearing business by increasing the size of her herd. To carry out this operation she needs a certain sum of money. Since she has no money, Chamangul has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and goats.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 6 filhos todos maiores de idade, tem 47 anos de idade, tem nível básico, muito batalhadora que a longos anos vive de negócio de venda de carne, criação de porcos, frangos e venda de ferro velho. Vive na casa própria e conta com ajuda dos filhos nas varias actividades. Esta a repetir o credito pela terceira vez, com os outros investiu no negocio e na compra de uma carrinha para o transporte da sua mercadoria para o mercado, com este pretende continuar a investir no mesmo negocio.
Pretende comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas, para ampliar a sua criação de frangos.
Seu sonho é desenvolver mais o seu negocio, concluir a construção de sua casa, abrir um talho onde possa vender o seu frango já abatido e carne de vaca. Futuramente pretende adquir uma viatura para saídas familiares.
O seu maior desafio, são os altos e baixos do seu negocio, as doenças que as vezes afectam a sua criação e actualmente a febre afectosa que faz com que não haja abates de vacas e isso de certa forma reduz o poder de compra de outros negócios.
texts.en:
Cacilda is a single mother of 6 adult children. She is 47 years old. She has a basic level of education. She is very hard working and for many years has supported herself selling meat, raising pigs and chickens, and selling used iron.

She owns her home and has help from her children in her various activities. This will be her third loan. The others were invested in her business and in the purchase of a wagon to transport her merchandise to the market. With this loan she plans to continue investing in the same business. She will purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins to raise more chickens.

Her dream is to continue to develop her business, to finish construction on her home, and to open a butcher shop where she can sell slaughtered chicken and beef. In the future she plans to by a vehicle for family outings.

Her greatest challenge is the ups and downs of her business, illnesses that sometimes affect her brood. Currently there is an outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease which means there is no slaughtering of cows. In a way, this reduces the purchasing power of other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins to grow her business raising chickens.

loans.name: Elias Alonso

texts.es: Don Elias de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una sastreria se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 9 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Elias is 61 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has a tailor's shop where he has been making clothing for nine years. His sewing shop is located in his residence and he has many clients because of the quality of the clothing he makes. The client is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. In this way he can continue with his work which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Jig

texts.en: Jig has owned and operated a transport service business for over seven years in order to earn a living. He has supported the family's daily needs with this income. His previous loan used for repairing his vehicle has been repaid successfully. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase new tires for motorcycle maintenance as part of his transportation services business. He wants to renovate his house for a safer and more comfortable living with his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Graciela De Jesus

texts.es: Graciela de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Graciela is 50 years old and lives in a house she owns with her family. She makes a living by selling fruit and soft drinks near her home. She is able to pay some of her household expenses with the earnings she obtains. The client is asking for another loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: The Women And The Sea - Gsơnhtrường Group

texts.en: Cầu is 55 years old and is married with five children. She has been fishing for more than 10 years. Cầu lives in Hoang Hoa District, Vietnam, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The income from her business is unstable because it is affected by natural disasters such as storms and floods. The main hardship that Cầu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase net and tools for fishing. Cầu joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Cầu has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of The Women and the Sea - GSơnHTrường, which consists of six members. In the future, Cầu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase net and tools for fishing.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  is 45 and the mother of 6 children.  She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She in embroiders to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.Nasreen buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits,  ribbons,  needles and an embroidery machine from the market to make her goods.  Another person handles her sales to her customers.  She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business.So Nasreen requested a loan in order to buy raw materials from the market.Nasreen is thankful to KIVA and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw material

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en: For the past three years, Leopoldo has owned and operated a retail store at home to earn a living. This venture sustains the needs of his family. Having repaid his previous loan that he used to purchase additional inventory, Leopoldo has requested a new one to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He hopes for further improvement of his enterprise to gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

location.town: SAPANG AMA, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer luchadora que poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de sus hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos en toda la ciudad. Ana desea seguir incrementando su negocio es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar mayor variedad de perfumes y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is a fighting woman who little by little has gotten ahead with the help of her siblings.

She sells perfumes and cosmetics throughout the city.

Ana wants to continue increasing her business so this is why she is asking for a loan to buy a wider variety of perfumes to satisfy customer demand. In this way she can increase her earnings and improve the household finances.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of perfumes

loans.name: Dalila Mercedes

texts.es:
Dalila ccon 43 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Dalila se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como aptos, pavos etc., desde hace 05 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales y comida para el engorde, para lo cual le generará mayor ingresos diarios a su unidad familiar.

Dalila si cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Dalila is 43 years old and separated from her spouse. She lives in her family’s home along with her two children. The community where she lives consists of modest people who engage in trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. This area is located in the District of Lagunas in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Dalila has been making a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks and turkeys for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying animals and food to fatten them. This will generate more income for daily household costs. This is Dalila's third loan with her credit institution "Edpyme Alternativa".

loans.use: to invest in buying animals, and food to fatten them.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Emelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials, like wood and bamboo, for the maintenance of her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emelita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like wood and bamboo, for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living from her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 4 years and she earns additional income running a general store. Armi is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
Saúl, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está casado, tiene 3 lindos hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también sale a vender productos de la Avon como cremas, perfumes, ropa interior etc. y son una familia muy unida.

Saúl, es un hombre de campo, sin embargo por los problemas de la sequía que ha vivido el país, ha decidido no sembrar esta vez, actualmente está trabajando para una vecina de su comunidad a la cual le cuida y ordeña sus vacas; pero a parte de eso siempre tiene en el patio de su casa cerdos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos y también obtiene ganancias con la reparación de bicicletas que tiene desde que era adolescente.

Saúl, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar cerdos y comprar alimento para engordarlos, para obtener ganancias con la venta de éstos.

Saúl, sueña con tener una granja porcina auto sostenible y de esta manera ir creciendo en el comercio de la carne de este animal, para mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl is 34 years old and has studied up until Grade 1. He is married and has 3 beautiful children. His wife works in the household, but also sells Avon products such as creams, perfumes, underwear, etc. They are a very close family.

Saúl is a man of the field. However, due to the problems of the drought that has currently prevailed in the country, he has decided not to plant this time. He is currently working for a neighbour in his community, providing care and milking for the neighbour's cows. Besides that, Saúl has always kept pigs in his own courtyard. Saúl then fattens and sells them. He also obtains income by repairing bicycles, which he as done since he was a teenager.

Saúl needs the loan money to buy pigs and food to fatten them, so he can obtain income from selling the pigs.

Saúl dreams of having a self-sustaining pig farm so he can expand his commercialization of the meat of this animal, so he can improve his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food to fatten them.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 28-year-old single woman. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 3 years and earns additional income from her tricycle transportation business.

She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and other items. Mary Joy has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF.

Mary Joy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, bread, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia’s place, where she runs her business of manufacturing concrete blocks. It’s located beside her house in Polomolok, South Cotabato. From cement, sand, gravel and water, her team builds concrete blocks for sale. She’s been in this business for ten years already, and it proves to be a good source of additional income for her family, because most of the time, her husband Danny’s income as a driver doesn’t suffice for their growing expenses.

Now Virginia is giving extra attention to her business. She realized that she cannot get enough clients while inside the manufacturing area. Therefore, she concentrates on marketing and networking to get volume orders from friends, neighbors, and relatives. She promotes her product to those who are planning to concretize their houses or other establishments. Virginia is preparing for mass production and she needs additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel.

She’s really working hard, hoping that her children will finish college with the aid of her profits. She also aspires to buy a sturdy vehicle to facilitate efficient delivery of her products.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel

loans.name: Viflor

texts.en:
Viflor is 56 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Viflor has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Asucena Maribel

texts.es:
Asucena, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja se dedica al mantenimiento de fontanería del proyecto de agua de su comunidad.

Asucena, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, más sin embargo también los días domingos sale con el equipo de fútbol de su comunidad al lugar donde juegan y aprovecha para vender panes con pollo y así generar ingresos para su casa, que le sirven para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar insumos para preparar los alimentos y una pequeña cocina para elaborarlos y comprar materia prima para elaborar tacos mexicanos, pues quiere agregar este producto a su negocio. 

Asucena, sueña con llegar a tener un negocio fuerte de venta de comida, con el cual generar suficientes ingresos para darle una excelente calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Asucena, 26 years old, is a hardworking woman. She studied until high school. She is happily accompanied by her partner who works maintaining plumbing for the community water project.

Asucena does the household chores. Moreover, she also goes with the community soccer team on Sundays to the place where they play. She takes the opportunity to sell chicken sandwiches to earn income for the home which serves to cover the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies to prepare food and for a small cooker to produce it and to buy raw materials to make Mexican tacos as she wants to add this product to her business.

Auscena dreams of having a strong food sales business which will generate sufficient income to give her son an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food and a small cooker to produce it and to buy raw materials to make Mexican tacos.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es habitante de Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca y reside en compañía de su familia en una vereda de este municipio, su anterior empleo en labores del campo como cultivadora de flores, le generó una enfermedad profesional por la que tuvo que retirarse de la esta labor, sin embargo su espíritu emprendedor le permitió crear su propio negocio en la finca donde reside y consideró que podría ubicar una tienda de comestibles para los trabajadores de la hacienda, de este modo en el año 2012, adecuó un espacio y en el que les,ofrece bebidas calientes entre ella café, aromáticas, agua de panela, panes, galletas, papas, gaseosas entre otros productos.   En la actualidad ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar un refrigerador que le permita mantener un stock apropiado de bebidas, las cuales son bastante consumidas por sus clientes. Su meta a futuro es poder ampliar su negocio y adquirir activos fijos. Su meta personal es pensionarse y comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is an inhabitant of Madrid a municipality of Cundinamarca and lives with her family in a village of this municipality. Her previous employment was field work growing flowers, but she got a sickness generated by her work and she had to quit this work.

Nevertheless her entrepreneurial spirit allowed her to create her own business on the farm where she lives and she thought she could open a food store for the workers on the farm. So in 2012 she adapted a space and in it she offers hot drinks like coffee, teas, agua de panela (sugar water), bread, biscuits, potatoes and soft drinks amongst other products.

She currently is applying for her first loan from Kiva processed through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.She will use it to buy a refrigerator which will allow her to keep a good stock of drinks which are consumed a lot by her clients. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and buy fixed assets. Her personal goal is to retire and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Heidi Marisela

texts.es:
Heidi, de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja trabaja como empleado de una distribuidora de lácteos, en la cual tiene el cargo de motorista de los camiones recolectores de leche en las ganaderías y vive en armonía junto a sus dos hijos.

Heidi, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero también en el patio de su casa crían cerdos, para que cuando han alcanzado cierto tamaño los venden y obtienen ganancias.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar un par de cerdos y para comprar alimentos y medicamentos para ellos y cierta parte la utilizarán para la reparación del chiquero, pues se encuentra un poco deteriorado.

Heidi, sueña con seguir aumentando su negocio de cría de cerdos, para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos y poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Heidi is 30 years old and attended school until the ninth grade. She is happily married, her partner is an employee of a distributor of dairy products . He drives one of the trucks that collect milk from the farms and lives in harmony with his two sons.

Heidi takes care of the housework, she also rears pigs in the courtyard of her home. When the pigs grow to a certain size she sells them to make an income.

Heidi is asking for a loan to buy a pair of pigs together with food and medicine for them.
Part of the loan will be used to repair the pigpen which is a little bit dilapidated.

Heidi hopes to be able to continue to grow her pig rearing business and increase her income. She wants to be able to provide a better life for her sons so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a pair of pigs together with food and medicine for them.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, de 63 años de edad, no estudio porque desde pequeño lo pusieron a trabajar la tierra, está acompañado, su pareja vida se dedica a la venta de pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña) desde su casa.

Concepción, desde pequeño ha trabajado en el campo, sin embargo actualmente trabaja como empleado en una quesera ubicada en el centro de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad, trabajo en el cual debe de estar desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar ropa para vender, porque quiere aprovechar la afluencia de personas que llegan a comer pupusas a su casa, para poderles ofrecer también ropa y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias a nivel familiar.

Concepción, sueña con vivir los últimos días de su vida junto a su amada esposa y viajar a los Estados Unidos para ir a visitar a sus hijos que desde hace mucho tiempo viven en dicho país.
texts.en:
Concepción is 63 years old. He has not studied since childhood since he was put to work in the fields. He has a partner who sells pupusas (traditional Salvadoran food) from their house.

Concepción has worked in the fields since he was small, but now works at a cheesemakers located in the centre of the city nearest his community. This work must be done from early morning until sunset.

The loan he is requesting is to buy clothing to sell, because he wants to take advantage of the influx of people who come to buy pupusas in his house. He can also offer them clothing, and in this way increase his profits at the household level.

Concepción dreams of living out the rest of his life with his beloved wife, and travelling to the United States to visit their children, who have lived in that country for a long time.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sahadete

texts.en:
Sahadete comes from the western part of Kosovo, where she lives with her three children, between the ages of 2 and 16 years old. Her husband works in a private hotel and she has been running her own seamstress business from her home for more than ten years now. Sahadete has a lot of demands recently and has been unable to satisfy the clients needs.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more materials that she needs for her work. She knows that she will be able to keep up with the demand and better satisfy her customers, giving her a chance to continue to grow her business and eventually have her own workshop in the future. She is very happy to be able to contribute to her family's budget and hopes that she can give her children a better education. She is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more materials that she needs for her own seamstress business

loans.name: Mukadzi Kushanda Group

texts.en:
Faustina is a woman who strongly believes that children are tomorrow’s future. She also believes that these children deserve to be cared for and nurtured from an early age so that they reach their fullest potential. With these strong belief systems, it is not hard to imagine why Faustina has always dreamt of starting her own pre-school. She is a single 28 year old vibrant woman who has set out to change the lives of children in her high density community of Chitungwiza.

Faustina opened her pre-school which is named after one of the warmest person known in history “Mother Theresa.” Her pre-school is undoubtedly a place where love and kindness flourishes. This can be easily seen because of the happily glowing faces of children in her care. Faustina has a total of 18 pupils, a number she certainly hopes to grow. Her pre-school has been facing numerous problems. These include very few toys, reading and play materials for the children to peacefully share.

Living in a high density area in Chitungwiza, water shortages are very common but with small children this can quickly become a health hazard. Faustina wants to buy a water tank that will cater for her pre-school. This is why Faustina and her friends came to Thrive to make up the group Mukadzi kushanda. They joined Thrive in August 2015. With a loan from Thrive Faustina can better develop her pre-school and attract more pupils and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her pre-school use.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Boroboro in Lira District. He is married with five children, three of whom are in school.

He operates a retail shop in Boroboro's trading center that generates money to support the education of his children and family. Daniel's shop is strategically located in a good place that has many customers, and this has increased demand. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Ugafode Mincrofinance, and he is grateful to Ugafode and Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to stock the shop.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 53 years old with four children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living.

Telesia requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: Alicia de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee un chalet donde vende pupusas y comida desde hace 20 años ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de harina de arroz y maiz, quesillo, pollos, carnes, frijoles, entre otros ingredientes para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Alicia is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. She has a stand located close to her residence where she has been selling pupusas and meals for 20 years. She has many clients and with the profits she makes, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy rice and corn flour, cheese, chicken, meat and beans amongst other ingredients to continue with her work and make greater profits.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn flour, cheese, chicken, meat and beans amongst other ingredients.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 40 years old, and he is married with two children. 

Amos has been selling retail goods for six years now and it has been profitable. 

Amos has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to purchase stock of plastic buckets, basins, flasks and water tanks for resale.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to expand his current business.

Amos' hope and dream for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of plastic buckets, basins, flasks and water tanks for resale.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
You can be an instrument to help Nemia reach her dreams!

Here is Nemia, a 53 year-old sari-sari (general) store owner from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She has run her business for 12 years now. The proliferation of this type of business makes the competition stiff; hence store owners like Nemia try many techniques to make their business stable and competitive. She combines her variety store with charcoal vending to encourage more buyers. Many residents in her community use charcoal stoves instead of LPG or electric stoves.

Nemia needs to strive harder because one of her children with Daniel, a farmer, is still studying. She wants to increase her income, and one way to attain this is to acquire supplementary capital of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy assorted groceries, sacks of rice and charcoal.

Nemia knocks at your generous hearts for your kind support. You can be assured that it will go a long, long way for her beloved family.

Nemia gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, sacks of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Nita is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Nita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Nita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Ma. Nita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ma. Nita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business

loans.name: Alanikie Solidarity Group

texts.en:
As a widow, Kumba is responsible for her three children with the ages of 18, 15 and 4 years all are attending school in Freetown. It is through this business that she has been able to provide for her family including her parents in the village. (see group picture, Kumba is in the middle).

Forteen years ago Kumba established her used clothing business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6days per week from 10am to 6pm.

She will use the proceeds from the business to open savings account which will be used in paying her children school fees.
Kumba and her group members need a loan totaling 3,000,000 SLL of which Kumba is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy 1 bale of used clothing etc. for her business.
Kumba plan to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.
Kumba and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 1 bale of used clothing etc. for her business

loans.name: Thembo

texts.en:
Thembo is married with children. He deals in a butchery business as his only source of income. He is doing very well, the fact that he is strategically located, and sells good meat.

Thembo now wants to buy items like a screen, and decoder for his house but still lacks some little money to do so at the moment. He requests a loan facility to buy a screen, and decoder for his house. He would be grateful for your support and will gladly pay back.

loans.use: to buy a screen, and decoder for his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly cost is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mmasi

texts.en: Mmasi is taking out another Kiva loan of Kshs 50,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Mmasi plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.  She is giving thanks to Kiva lender and Yehu for the opportunity given as it has improved her family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming as her business.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 38-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 4 children. Her husband has been working at a service station for many years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family. Noreen provides sewing services to earn extra income to contribute to the household.

Noreen needs various goods such as needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, and other items for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items, which will help her provide better sewing services and increase her monthly sales and profit.

Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elsa Ruth

texts.es: Elsa humilde, ahorrativa tiene 51 años esta casada, su esposo es albañil ultimamente el trabajo esta escaso y junto con sus tres hijos Andrea, Stalin y Mónica le ayudan desde las cuatro de la mañana a comprar papa en el mercado mayorista y luego ir a vender a los restaurantes, bares escolares,en los barrios cercanos etc. Elsa necesita el dinero para poder aumentar la compra de papas, obtener màs ganancias, asi cubrir con los gastos bàsicos de su familia.
texts.en: Elsa is a humble woman who is 51 years old. She is married and her husband is a mason. Recently, work has been scarce and he, along with their three children, Andrea, Stalin and Monica, help by going to the market every morning at 4 in the morning in order to purchase potatoes on wholesale. They then sell the potatoes to local restaurants, bars, schools and nearby neighborhoods. She needs the loan today in order to purchase potatoes in higher quantities and to earn more money so she can cover the basic household costs for her family.

loans.use: purchase more potatoes.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is the age of 28 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in dairy farming to earn an income. She started her factory 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She has buffaloes and cows in her small dairy farm that produce milk, which she sells in her town. By breeding her buffalo, her husband has been increasing his herd over the years. Riffat wants to buy a cow for her dairy farm to earn a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to buy a cow for her dairy farm.  She has decided that she would like to increase the number of cows in her dairy farm so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in dairy farming. Therefore, Riffat has demanded a loan so she will be able to buy a cow. Riffat is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her dairy farm

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 34 ans, Akou est mère de deux enfants et vit à Tokoin. Akou est une marchandes des oranges qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Akou réalise une bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Akou sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs d’oranges en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: A 34 year old widow, Akou is a mother of two children and lives in Tokoin. Akou sells oranges and gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells them under a shed on the roadside. Akou achieves a good profitability with her income-earning activity. Akou asks for this credit to order bags of oranges with a view to sell well and also earn profits in order to support her children's school education.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of oranges.

loans.name: Nyomo-Bei Group

texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the group called nyomo-bei. This group is located in Teshie, Accra-Ghana which is an urban poor area in the capital city of the country.
They are into the sale of phone credit cards, pastries, baf loaf, grocery, bowls and plates, eggs, pork, vegetables, corn and cassava dough, also provide sewing services.

This borrower is Gifty. She is 26 years old and she is married with one child. She alternates her personal activities with the phone credit cards, pastries, baf loaf, grocery business. She has had this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to keep working so she can continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy more phone credit cards, pastries, baf loaf and grocery which she will sell to her customers. She operates this business from a kiosk at the road side where more economics activities go on.

The borrowers in general are thankful for the loan and committed to making their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more phone credit cards, pastries, baf loaf and grocery which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta’s boarding house, located in Polomolok, South Cotabato. She was able to build it from the combined income of her variety store business and her husband Carino’s regular salary. Their eldest child, who is already working, also contributed an amount to build this. They pulled off their efforts together, so as to have an additional source of income because two children are currently studying in college and expenses are bloating.

Since the family resources were concentrated in this boarding house in the past months, Loreta’s variety store suffers from a lack of supplies nowadays. Her rolling capital was used up.

To continue with her store business, Loreta applied for a loan worth PHP 22,000, which she can use to buy stocks of groceries, toiletries, snacks, and soft drinks. She will also add sandals, slippers, shoes, and bags. She’s hoping that it will lead to a higher profit that can sustain their everyday needs and the college expenses of her children. She would be happy to see them enjoying a better career after their schooling.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries, toiletries, snacks, soft drinks, sandals, slippers, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 69 years old and married with eleven children.

Arsenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. Arsenia has been raising pigs for the past 11 years, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has successfully paid back her previous loans and she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cecille works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Cecille is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients, like meat, fish, spices, and flour and additional utensils for her food production business.

Cecille has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, fish, spices, and flour and additional utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Gloria Fany

texts.es: Gloria es una microempresaria habitante de Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca que reside con su familia en esta localidad y emprendió su negocio al comprar su vivienda, al percatarse que en el sector había carencia de este tipo de negocio en sus alrededores, decidió aperturar su tienda de víveres y abarrotes en un espacio de su casa.  En la actualidad cuenta con una tienda muy bien surtida que ofrece a la comunidad productos frescos y seleccionados, entre ellos verduras, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, productos de panadería, refrescos, golosinas entre otros productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar a excelentes precios y en un horario amplio para que todos puedan realizar sus compras.   En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar adecuaciones al local y lograr ampliarlo para colocar estanterías y poder exhibir mucho mejor los productos. Su meta a futuro es tener un negocio más grande que le permita costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria's a micro-entrepreneur who lives with her family in Madrid, a town in Cundinamarca. She started her business when she bought her home and perceived a need for this type of store in the area. She decided to open a grocery and supply store in a space in her house.

Now she has a very well-stocked store where she sells fresh and selected products to the community at excellent prices and during extensive hours so everyone can go shopping. She sells vegetables, meat, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, candy, and other products from the family shopping basket.

Currently she's applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She's going to make modifications on her store so she can expand it and put in shelving to better display her products.

Her goal for the future is to have a bigger business so she can pay for her children's college education.

loans.use: to make modifications to expand her store and put in shelving

loans.name: Kauchi

texts.en:
Kauchi is a widowed woman with six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly cost is school fees.

For one year now, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Thabu

texts.en:
