Thabu is a widowed woman with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly costs are school fees and food.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Kasirimi

texts.en:
Kasirimi is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly cost is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly cost is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Kakala

texts.en:
Kakala is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly costs are food and school fees

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, terminó la educación primaria, y desde que era pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar en los campos de algodón, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales una de ellas está estudiando licenciatura en comunicaciones, el otro trabaja en una pizzería y la menor se encuentra aún estudiando.

Elena, desde hace 6 años su hermana le enseño a elaborar tamales de gallina, de maíz y de frijol, también hace empanadas y atoles (poleadas, arroz en leche y atol negrito), en esta actividad le ha ido muy bien, pues genera suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia, desde tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta para elaborar los productos, aunque algunos los hace en la tarde, porque cada producto tiene su diferente horario de venta, por ejemplo los atoles los vende por la mañana y los tamales por la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar maíz e insumos para la elaboración de más productos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, el resto será utilizado en el mejoramiento de una habitación de su hijo varón.

Elena, sueña con sacar a sus hijos adelante y que éstos lleguen a ser profesionales y que sean personas de bien que sirvan a la sociedad y sean un orgullo de su madre.
texts.en:
Elena is 44 years old and a very strong woman. She finished primary school, and since she was little she was taught to work in the cotton fields. She is a single mother of 3 children, one of whom is studying for a Bachelor's in Communications, one of whom works in a pizzeria, and the youngest is still in school.

For 6 years Elena's sister has trained her how to make chicken, corn, and beef tamales, as well as empanadas and atoles (a cornflour drink with rice and milk). In this activity she has done very well. It generates enough income to support her family. She rises early in the morning to make these products, although some she makes in the afternoon, because each product has a different sale time, for example the atoles are sold in the morning and the tamales in the afternoon.

The loan she is requesting is to buy corn and supplies to make more products and therefore improve her income. The rest will be used for improving her son's room.

Elena dreams of providing for her children, and that they will become professionals and good people who will be of service to society. She hopes they will be proud of their mother.

loans.use: to buy corn and supplies for the production of more products.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 27 and a mother of three children. Living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan, she engages in dairy farming to earn an income. She started her farm 12 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. On her small dairy farm, she has buffalo and cows that produce milk, which she sells in her town. Through breeding her buffalo, her husband has been increasing his herd over the years.

Shazia wants to buy buffalo for her dairy farm to earn a proper income, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to. She has decided that she would like to increase the number of buffalo on her dairy farm so that she can earn better profits for her family. She has become an expert in dairy farming. So, Shazia has requested a loan so she will be able to buy buffalo.

Shazia will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy buffalo for her dairy farm

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one child. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rafia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rafia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nyakabare Women Group

texts.en:
The lady on the left-hand side, wearing a sweater in the group photo, is named Jovulet. She is a new client to the organization, who has applied for a loan of 500.000 UGX through Nyakabare Group, which is a totally new group that has joined UGAFODE to benefit from financial support offered. The group applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX and is located at Nyakabare, Kebisoni, Rukungiri district.

The 51-year-old woman is married and blessed with four children. She resides in Kebisoni, Rukungiri district. She operates a vegetable stall at a local market as her major source of income, which she uses to cater for her entire family's financial obligations. However, she found out that her business alone could not meet all of her financial needs. Therefore, she joined UGAFODE to access financial assistance to expand her business and meet her financial demands.

She is taking this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to increase her business stock, including yellow bananas, greens, matooke (green plantain), onions and tomatoes, and she is hopeful that her dreams will come true and her businesses will improve gradually. The whole group thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance, which will enable them to educate their children, sustain their businesses, and earn a living.

loans.use: to buy yellow bananas, greens, tomatoes and onions among other items to sell
